SECRETARY OF THE cnMwnNWPAJTH 



Massachusetts Soldiers and Sailors 

IN THE 

War of the Revolution. 



Note. — All names are given exactly as they appear on the original records. The order of 
arrangement of the facts of service in each individual record given is the same, as nearly as pos- 
sible, as the original entries, and is as follows : The name; the place of residence, if given; the 
rank; the kind of document whereon the record appears; the enlistment and discharge, if 
given; the time of service; remarks. 

A discrepancy will sometimes be noted between the service given and the actual service as 
figured between the dates of enlistment and discharge. The difference is accounted for by the 
practice of including, with service performed, a time allowance for travel on the basis of one 
day for every 20 miles out or home. As the same name may appear under various forms, each 
carrying some portion of a record of service, it is necessary in order to obtain the complete 
record, as far as preserved, of any given individual, to examine all the forms under which 
a name is stated to appear in the Record Index. 



COSE, JoHx. Sergeaiit, Capt. Moses Ashley's co., Col. Joseph Vose's regt. ; Conti- 
nental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to May 2.5, 1778; also, 
muster roll for Dec, 1777, dated Camp near Valley Forge; enlisted Jan. 1, 1777; 
enlistment, during war; reported sick at Albany. [See John Cox.] 

CosEN, Ebexezer, Wells. Private, Capt. John Lane's (Seacoast) co. ; enlisted Aug. 
17, 1775 ; service to Nov. 1, 1775, 2 mos. 19 days, travel included ; company prol> 
ably stationed at Cape Ann. [See Ebenezer Courson.] 

CosEN, Hatevil, Penobscot. Private, Capt. John Lane's (Seacoast) co. ; enlisted July 
14, 1775; service to Nov. 1, 1775, 3 mos. 25 days, travel included; company 
probably stationed at Cape Ann. [See Hatevil Coulson.] 

CosENS, Ebexezer S. Receipt dated Wells, Aug. 20, 1782, for bounty paid said Cosens 
by Joseph Taylor, Chairman of a class of the town of Wells, to serve in the Con- 
tinental Army. 

CosExs, JoHX. Private, Capt. Joshua Nason's co., (late) Col. Storer's regt. ; enlisted 
Aug. 14, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 30, 1777, at Queman's Heights; service, 123 days, 
travel included, with Northern army. Roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. 

CosEE, William, Boscawen. Descriptive list of enlisted men raised agreeable to 
resolve of April 20, 1778; age, 21 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; complexion, sandy; 
hair, black ; eyes, black ; residence, Boscawen ; enlisted for town of Newburyport. 

CosET, Abel. Private, Capt. Joseph Jones's co. ; warrant to pay officers and men dated 
March 26, 1783. [See Abel Carrey.] 

CosGRiFF, Dexxis. Col. Joscph Vose's (1st) regt. ; list of deserters dated Camp High- 
lands, N. Y., July 13, 1780; age, 25 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 6 in.; complexion, light; 
hair, light; birthplace, Ireland. 



2 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

CosGKOFF, Dennis. List of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for 
Suffolk Co., dated Boston, Feb. 2, 1777 ; Capt. Tuckerman's co., Col. John Patter- 
son's regt. ; enlistment, 3 years. 

CosGROVE, . [This name appears under the form of Cosgriff, Cosgroff, Cosscriff, 

Cossgriff, Crosgrove.] 

CosiL, Thomas. Capt. Henry Jenne's co. ; enlisted March 1-1, 1781 ; discharged March 
18, 1781 ; service, 4 days ; company marched to Rhode Island. 

CosiNS, Samuel, Jr., Blue Hill Bay, No. 4. Return of men enlisted or hired to serve 
in the Continental Army from Capt. Larkin Thorndike's, Capt. John Woodbury's 
and Capt. Joseph R[ae]'s (1st, 2d and 3d Beverly) cos., dated Beverly, Feb. 13, 
1778; residence. Blue Hill Bay, No. 4; hired for town of Beverly; joined Capt. 
William Porter's co.. Col. Francis's regt.; enlistment, 3 years; reported as 
belonging to 1st Beverly co. 

CosKiNS, Anthony, Boston. Return of men enlisted or drafted into Continental Army 
from 1st Essex Co. regt., dated Lynn, Feb. 16, 1778, and sworn to at Salem, Feb. 
16, 1778, by John Flagg, first military officer of the town of Lynn ; residence, 
Boston ; engaged for town of Lynn ; joined Capt. Williams's co.. Col. Greaton's 
regt. ; term, during war. 

CosLEY, Nathan. Private, Capt. Amasa Soper's co.. Col. Thomas Marshall's regt. ; 
enlisted June 11, 1776; service to Aug. 1, 1776, 1 mo. 21 days. [See Nathan 
Crossley.] 

Coss, Jonathan. Private, Capt. Ichabod Bonney's co., Col. Nathan Sparhawk's regt. ; 
marched Oct. 5, 1778; service, 2 mos. 11 days, at Castle Island. 

CossA, Edward. Capt. Sabin Mann's co. of Medfield militia ; return of alarm list 
with equipments dated June 10, 1776. 

CossA,EzEKiEL. Private, Capt. Joseph Smith's (Seacoast) co. ; enlisted July 19, 1775; 
discharged Dec. 31, 1775 ; service, 5 mos. 25 days. 

Cosscriff, Dennis. Private, Capt. Mills's co.. Col. Joseph Vose's regt. ; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Nov. 7, 1777; reported de- 
serted ; also, Capt. Abraham Tuckerman's co., Col. Vose's regt. ; muster roll for 
Dec, 1777, sworn to in Camp near Valley Forge; enlisted Jan. 1, 1777; enlist- 
ment, during war; reported prisoner at Albany. 

Cossee, Joshua. List of men enlisted or drafted into Continental Army from 3d Plym- 
outh Co. regt., returned agreeable to order of Council of Nov. 7, 1777 ; engaged 
for town of Bridgewater; joined Capt. D. Allen's co., Col. Crain's regt.; term, 
3 years. 

CossENS, Nicholas, Boston. Return of men enlisted into Continental Army from 
Capt. Samuel Ward's and Capt. Thomas Nash's cos.. Col. David Cushing's regt., 
dated Weymouth, Jan. 2, 1778; residence, Boston; enlisted for town of Wey- 
mouth ; joined Capt. Drury's co., Col. John Crane's regt. ; enlistment, 3 years. 

Cossgriff, Dennis. Return of men enlisted into Continental Army from Capt. Endi- 
cott's CO., Col. Benjamin Gill's regt., dated Stoughton, June 27, 1777; enlisted for 
town of Stoughton (also given Weymouth) ; joined Capt. Tuckerman's co., Col. 
Wiglesworth's regt. ; enlistment, 3 years ; reported a foreigner. 

CossoN, Adam. Private, Capt. Timothy Foster's co., Maj. Lithgo's detachment of 
militia; service from Sept. 1, 1779, to Nov. 1, 1779, 2 mos., defending frontiers 
after the defeat. Roll sworn to in Lincoln Co. 

CosTEKiN, Anthony, Lynn. List of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster Mas- 
ter for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, April 13, 1777 ; Capt. Joseph Williams's co., 
Col. John Greaton's (2d) regt. ; residence, Lynn ; enlisted for town of Lynn.

Costilo, John. Receipt dated Boston, April 29, 1782, for bounty paid said Costilo by 
Alexander Hodgdon, in behalf of a committee of the town of Boston, to serve in 
the Continental Army for the term of 3 years. 

Costilo, Mattheav, Beverly. Seaman, brigantine " Defence," commanded by Capt. 
John Edmonds; descriptive list of officers and crew sworn to Aug. 21, 1781; 
stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; complexion, light; residence, Beverly. 

Costiloe, John. Seaman, ship "Protector," commanded by Capt. John Foster Wil- 
liams; engaged Feb. 8, 1780; discharged Aug. 17, 1780; service, 6 mos. 9 days. 

Costin, . [This name also appears under the form of Coston.] 

CosTiN, John. Seaman, brig " Hazard," commanded by Capt. John Foster Williams; 
engaged May 12, 1779; service to Sept. 6, 1779, 3 mos. 26 days; nationality, 
Irish ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. ; also. Seaman, ship " Pro- 
tector," commanded by Capt. John Foster Williams; engaged March 5, 1780; 
discharged Aug. 17, 1780; service, 5 mos. 12 days. 

Costin, Joseph. Petition dated Boston, April 22, 1780, signed by Codman & Smith 
of Boston, requesting that said Costin be commissioned as commander of the 
brigantine "Fame " (privateer) ; ordered in Council April 22, 1780, that a com- 
mission be issued. 

Costleav [?], John. Enlistment agreement dated Oct. -, 1775, signed by said Cost- 
leau and others, engaging themselves to serve in the Continental Army for 1 year 
from the last of Dec, 1775. 

Coston, Levi. Private, Capt. Peter IngersoU's co.. Col. John Brown's (Berkshire Co.) 
regt. ; enlisted July 1, 1777; discharged July 30, 1777; service, 30 days, includ- 
ing travel to camp and home. 

Coston, Timothy. Private, Capt. Elisha Shapleigh's co., (late) Col. Joseph Storer's 
regt.; enlisted Aug. 14, 1777; discharged Oct. 23, 1777; service, 85 days, travel 
included. Roll sworn to at Kittery. 

Costos, Richard. Seaman, brigantine " Massachusetts," commanded by Capt. Daniel 
Souther; engaged Aug. 17, 1776; discharged Dec. 21, 1776; service, 4 mos. 4 
days. 

CoswEL, Beal, Mansfield. Private, Capt. Jacob Fuller's co.. Col. John Jacobs's regt. ; 
enlisted June 2, 1778 ; service, 7 mos. 1 day, at Rhode Island ; enlistment to ex- 
pire Jan. 1, 1779. 

Coswell, Joseph. Private, Capt. Lemuel KoUock's co.. Col. Wheelock's regt.; 
marched from Wrentham to Warwick, R. I., on the alarm of Dec. 8, 1776; ser- 
vice, 14 days. 

CoszENS, Richard. Private, Capt. John Holden's (2d) co.. Col. Christopher Greene's 
(1st Rhode Island) battalion ; muster roll for July, 1779, dated Camp East Green- 
wich ; enlistment, during war ; reported on guard. 

Cote, Jean (also given John). Private, Capt. Gawen Brown's co.. Col. Henry Jack- 
son's regt.; pay roll for Feb., 1778, dated "Gulf;" also, same co. and regt.; 
pay rolls for June, July and Aug., 1778, dated Providence; also, Capt. Thomas 
Turner's (9th) co., Col. Henry Jackson's regt. ; muster roll for April, 1779, dated 
Pawtuxet ; enlisted Nov. 20, 1777 ; enlistment, 3 years ; reported sick at Stanford. 



4 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

CoTEALL, Peter, Barnstable. List of men mustered by Joseph Otis, Muster Master for 
Barnstable Co. ; Capt. Russel's co., Col. Bradford's regt. ; residence, Barnstable; 
mustered April 23, 1777; enlistment, 3 years. 

CoTEELL, Philip, Marblehead. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as 
received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, 
July 15, 1780; age, 36 j'rs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4 in.; complexion, dark; residence, 
Marblehead; marched to camp July 15, 1780, under command of Capt. James 
Cooper. [See Philip Colate and Philip Cautelle.] 

CoTELL, Peter, Barnstable. Return of men enlisted into Continental Army dated 
May 10, 1778; resielence, Barnstable; enlisted for town of Barnstable; joined 
Capt. John Russel's co.. Col. Bradford's regt. ; enlistment, 3 years, to expire 
April -, 1781 ; also, Private, Major's co.. Col. Heniy Jackson's regt. ; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from April 29, 1778, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Lieut. 
Thomas H. Condy's (2d) co., Col. Jackson's (16th) regt. ; pay roll for Nov., 1778 ; 
also, same co. and regt.; pay roll for Feb., 1779, dated Pawtuxet; also, Maj. 
Lemuel Trescott's (3d) co.. Col. Jackson's regt. ; muster roll for April, 1779, dated 
Pawtuxet ; reported furloughed April 25, 1779, by Gen. Glover ; also, same co. and 
regt. ; muster roll for July, 1779, dated Providence ; also, same co. and regt. ; 
pay roll for Oct., 1779; also, Major's co., Col. Jackson's regt.; return made up to 
Dec. 31, 1779, dated Camp at Providence; enlisted April 29, 1778; reported de- 
serted Dec. 21, 1779. 

Coten, John Babes ( ?). Corporal, Capt. Abijah Bangs's co., Col. Dike's regt.; pay 
abstract for gun and blanket money dated Boston, Feb. 24, 1777. 

Cotes, Charles, Hadley. Capt. Eliakim Smith's co.. Col. Ward's regt.; order for 
advance pay dated Cambridge, June 9, 1775 ; also. Private, same co. and regt. ; 
muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 4, 1775; service, 3 mos. 5 days; 
also, Capt. Moses Kellogg's co.. Col. Jonathan Ward's regt.; company return 
[probably Oct., 1775] . 

Cotes, Elihu. Private, Capt. Abner Pomeroy's co.. Col. Ezra Wood's regt. ; pay roll 
for part of May and the month of June, 1778; service, 1 mo. 11 days; also, same 
CO. and regt.; pay rolls for Aug. and Sept., 1778; service, 2 mos. [See William 
Cots.] 

Cotes, John. List of men enlisted into Continental Army from 5th Hampshire Co. 
regt. [year not given] endorsed "Col. David Field's return"; enlisted for town 
of Bernardston ; enlistment, 8 months. 

Cotes, Simeon. Descriptive list of enlisted men raised agreeable to resolve of June 
9, 1779, returned as received of Noah Goodman, Superintendent for Hampshire 
Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, at Springfield, Oct. 19, 1779; Capt. Wols- 
worth's CO., Col. Wells's regt.; age, 21 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in.; hair, brown; 
enlisted for town of Bernardston; enlistment, 9 months; delivered to Ensign 
T. Clark. 

Coth, Simeon. Private, Capt. Joseph Elliot's co., Col. William Thomas's regt.; en- 
listed Aug. 25, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 27, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 7 days, travel in- 
cluded, at Rhode Island. Roll dated Camp at Battes Hill, Dec. 1, 1781. 

Cothrell, Daniel, New Braintree. Capt. John Grainger's co.. Col. Ebenezer Learned's 
regt. ; receipt for bounty coat dated Rox-bury Camp, Nov. 9, 1775. 

Cothren, Adam. Private, Capt. Joseph Jones's co. ; marched June 29, 1779; dis- 
charged July 16, 1779; service, 17 days, at Camden, Lincoln Co., by order of Col. 
William Jones.

to Dec. 31, 1779, dated Camp at Providence.

said regt. ; ordered in Council May 9, 1776, that a commission be issued ; reported 
commissioned May 9, 1776. 

CoTLER, Amos. Capt. Benjamin Alton's co., Col. John Rand's regt. ; order dated 
Sutton, Jan. 25, 1782, for wages for 3 months service in 1780. 

CoTLY, Samvel. List of men mustered by Thomas Newhall, Muster Master for 
Worcester co. ; Capt. Isaac Pope's co.. Col. William Shepard's regt. ; mustered 
June 15, 1777 ; enlistment, 3 years ; reported deserted June 16, 1777. 

CoTON, Thaddeus. Private, Capt. John Grannis's (Seacoast) co. ; enlisted Aug. 26, 
1776; service to Aug. 31, 1776, 4 days; company stationed at Tarpaulin Cove, 
Elizabeth Islands. 

CoTREL, Benjamin, Roxbury. Private, Capt. Thomas Mayo, Jr.'s co., Col. Eleazer 
Weld's detachment of militia; service from Dec. 9 to Dec. 29, 1776, 20 days, 
probably at Hull. 

CoTRUE, Baptiste. List of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for 
Suffolk Co., dated Boston, Dec. 7, 1777; Capt. Langdon's co.. Col. Henry Jack- 
son's regt. 

Cots, Elihxj. Private, Capt. Lemuel Pomeroy's co.. Col. John Dickerson's regt. ; en- 
listed Sept. 20, 1777; discharged Oct. 14, 1777; service, 30 days, travel included, 
under Col. Ezra May on expedition to Saratoga. Roll sworn to in Hampshire Co. 

Cots, William. Private, Capt. Abner Pomroy's co.. Col. Ezra M'ood's regt. ; ser- 
vice, 7 mos. 27 days, travel included; company marched to state of New York; 
enlistment, 8 months ; roll made up for wages agreeable to resolve of April 20, 
1778. [See Elihu Coats and Elihu Cotes.] 

CoTTAL, Samuel. Private, Capt. Jacob Lovell's co.. Col. Freeman's regt.; service, 6 
days, on an alarm at Bedford, Dartmouth and Falmouth, in Sept., 1778.

6 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

CoTTEL, Abner. Private, Capt. John Russell's co. ; service from Sept. 30, 1776, to 
Nov. 22, 1776, 1 mo. 22 days, under Maj. Barachiah Bassett at Martin's [Martha's] 
Vineyard in defence of seacoast. 

CoTTEL, Isaac. Private, Capt. John Grannis's (Seacoast) co. ; service from March 1, 
1776, to June 1, 1776. Roll dated Tarpaulin Cove. 

CpTTEL, Robert. List of men enlisted or drafted into Continental Army from 2d 
Plymouth Co. regt., as returned by Capt. Josiah Gushing, sworn to in Plymouth 
Co., Feb. 14, 1778 ; engaged for town of Pembroke ; joined Capt. Turner's co.. Col. 
Bradford's regt. ; term, 3 years. 

Cottel, William. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Parker Foster's 11th (6th Kittery) co.. Col. 
John Frost's (2d York Co.) regt.; list of officers of Mass. militia dated Kittery, 
April 23, 1776; ordered in Council April 29, 1776, that a commission be issued; 
reported commissioned April 29, 1776; said Cottel i-eported to have refused to 
accept his commission in a return dated Kittery, Sept. 3, 1776, and Timothy 
Spinney commissioned Nov. 14, 1776, in his stead. 

Cottelier, . [This name appears under the form of Cotilier, Cottellier, Cottille, 

Coutelieu.] 

Cottellier, Charles. Private, Capt. Hunt's co., Col. Henry Jackson's regt. ; Con- 
tinental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; also, 
Capt. Thomas Turner's (5th) co., Col. Jackson's (16th) regt. ; pay rolls for April- 
July, 1780 ; also, descriptive list of enlisted men dated Hutts, three miles from West 
Point, Jan. 28, 1781; age, 22 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in.; complexion, dark; hair, 
brown ; enlisted Nov. 20, 1777, by Capt. Langdon ; rank. Private ; joined Capt. 
Turner's co., 9th Mass. regt., commanded by Col. Henry Jackson; enlistment, 
during war; reported a Frenchman, also a transient. 

Gotten, Benjamin. Private, Capt. Benjamin Perkins's co.. Col. Gai-rish's regt. ; com- 
pany return for the year 1775. 

Gotten, Edward. Private, Capt. Jesse Sturtevant's co.. Col. Titcomb's regt. ; marched 
to Rhode Island April 28, 1777; service, 2 mos. 5 days. Roll dated Halifax. 

Gotten, John, Brunswick. List of men enlisted or drafted into Continental Army 
from Col. Jonathan Mitchell's (2d Cumberland Co.) regt., as returned by Maj. 
Nathaniel Larrabee, dated Brunswick, Dec. 10, 1777; residence, Brunswick; en- 
gaged for town of Newbury; joined Capt. Davis's co.. Col. Francis's regt.; 
term, 3 years ; also, list of men raised in Lincoln Co. agreeable to resolve of Dec. 
2, 1780, returned as received by Luke Lambard at Bath, Jan. 22, 1782, to be con- 
ducted to Boston ; age, 39 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in. ; complexion, light; residence, 
Brunswick ; engaged for town of Topsham; reported belonged to 1st Lincoln Co. 
regt. 

Gotten, John. Private, Capt. John Spoor's co.. Col. John Ashley's (Berkshire Co.) 
regt. ; enlisted Sept. 19, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 19, 1777 ; service, 31 days ; marched 
to Stillwater. Roll certified by Brig. Gen. John Fellows at Sheffield, Dec. 15, 1777. 

Gotten, Josiah, Falmouth, Barnstable Co. Pay roll for 6 months men raised by the 
town of Falmouth for service in the Continental Army during 1780; marched 
July 6, 1780; discharged Oct. 12, 1780; service, 3 mos. 21 days. 

Gotten, Thaddeus. Private, Capt. John Grannis's (Seacoast) co., commanded by 
Lieut. James Blossom; enlisted Sept. 1, 1776; service to Nov. 21, 1776, 2 mos. 
21 days, at Elizabeth Islands. 

Gotten, Thomas. Private, Capt. George Rogers's co., Col. Nathaniel Jordan's regt.;

Cotter, Jabies. Private, Capt. James Gregg's co.. Col. Goose Van Schaick's (1st 
New York) regt. ; muster roll for Jan.-March, 1781, dated West Point; reported 
absent at New Windsor with leave; also, same co. and regt.; muster roll for 
April, 1781, dated West Point; enlistment, during war. 

CoTTERAL, Nicholas. Private, Capt. Joel Stevens's co.. Col. David Rosseter's regt. ; 
enlisted Oct. 12, 1781 ; discharged Oct. 25, 1781 ; service, 13 days, on an alarm at 
Saratoga. Roll dated Pittsfield. 

Cotterel, Nicholas, Worthington. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Webber's (9th) co., Col. 
John Fellows's (8th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 4, 1775 ; 
service, 3 mos. 3 days; also, company return dated Dorchester, Oct. 7, 1775; re- 
ported on Quebec expedition. 

CoTTERELL, AsA. Private, Lieut. Constant Webster's co. ; enlisted Aug. 15, 1777 ; dis- 
charged Aug. 23, 1777 ; service, 12 days, travel included ; company marched from 
Worthington to reinforce army under Gen. Stark at Bennington ; also, Capt. 
Ebenezer Webber's co.. Col. Ezra May's regt. ; enlisted Sept. 20, 1777 ; dis- 
charged Oct. 14, 1777 ; service, 29 days, travel included, on expedition to Stillwater. 

CoTTERELL, RiCHARD, Newport. Fifer, Capt. Noah Allen's co.. Col. Calvin Smith's 
(late Wigglesworth's) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from

(late) Col. Wigglesworth's regt. ; muster roll for March and April, 1779, dated

CO., Col. Smith's regt.; Continental Army paj^ accounts for service from Jan. 1, 
1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; residence, Newport. 

CoTTERiL, Richard, Newport. Descriptive list of enlisted men dated West Point, 
Jan. 29, 1781; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 4 ft. 8 in.; complexion, light; hair, light; 
eyes, light; residence, Newport; enlisted June -, 1779, by Capt. Allen; rank, 
Fifer; joined Capt. Ebenezer Smith's co., Lieut. Col. Smith's (6th) regt.; enlist- 
ment, during war; also, Fifer, Capt. Ebenezer Smith's co., Lieut, Col. Calvin 
Smith's (6th) regt. ; wages allowed for Jan., 1781-Dec., 1782, 24 months. 

CoTTERiLL, Asa, Worthington. Private, Capt. Oliver Lyman's co., Col. Dike's regt. ; 
pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., dated Dorchester, Nov. 27, 1776. 

CoTTiLLE, Philip, Marblehead. Matross, Col. Lamb's (Artillery) regt. ; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from Sept. 8, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; enlistment, 
during war. 

CoTTix, Elias. Petition signed by Paul Hussey of Nantucket, asking that measures 
be taken for the exchange of said Cottin and other prisoners confined on board 
prison-ships at New York ; ordered in Council Aug. 12, 1777, that the petition be 
granted. 

CoTTiN, JoHX. Private, Capt. Samuel Fales's co.. Col. J. Dagget's regt. ; marched to 
Rhode Island Jan. 6, 1778; discharged April 1, 1778; service, 2 mos. 26 days; 
company drafted to serve under Gen. Spencer for 3 months from Jan. 1, 1778.

8 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

Cottle, Jabez. Captain of a company in Col. Ebenezer Sprout's (Plymouth Co.) regt., 
which company marched to Fogland Ferry, K.. I., under command of Lieut. 
Barnabas Doty on an alarm Dec. 8, 1776; also, Captain of a company raised in

the time of their arrival at Fishkill, July 17, 1778 ; residence, Ipswich ; also, Cor- 
poral, Capt. John Blunt's co.. Col. Samuel McCobb's regt. ; enlisted June 28, 
1779; discharged Sept. 28, 1779; service, 3 mos-, at Penobscot; also, Sergeant, 
Capt. Blunt's co. ; service between March 6, 1780, and Sept. 6, 1780, 3 mos. 5 
days, under Brig. Gen. Wadsworth ; company raised for defence of eastern 
Massachusetts; roll endorsed " Col. Prime's regt."

(30th) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 20, 1775; service, 2

27, 1775.

24 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

CovEL, Henkt, Hancock. Private, Lieut. Daniel Brown's co., Col. Benjamin Simonds's 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; enlisted Oct. 13, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 17, 1780 ; service, 
5 days, on an alarm ; also, petition signed by said Covel, asking for wages for the 
time he was in captivity; stating that he enlisted for 3 months in 1781 in Capt. 
Samuel Clark's co., was taken pi-isoner by the Indians near Mohawk river, N. Y., 
Sept. 7, 1781, and carried to Canada; that he remained a prisoner until Dec. 2, 
1782, when he was landed at Boston in a destitute condition; also, certiticate 
dated Williamstown, June 24, 1783, signed by Capt. Samuel Clarck, stating that 
said Covel served in his company in 1781, was taken prisoner Sept. 7, 1781, at 
Canada Creek near Fort Harkemer, and probably carried to Niagara. 

Covel, Jethro. Private, Capt. Benjamin Smith's (Seacoast) co. ; service from Jan. 18, 
1776, to Nov. 21, 1776, 10 mos. 5 days, at Martha's Vineyard ; reported as serving 
as Fifer from Sept. 1, 1776.

CO., Col. Nathaniel Freeman's regt. ; pay roll for Oct., 1777; service, 31 days, on

manded by Capt. Elisha Hinman; descriptive list of officers and crew dated

CoviLL, Benjamin, Harwich. List of men mustered by Joseph Otis, Muster Master 
for Barnstable Co., dated April 14, 1777 ; Capt. George Webb's co., Col. Shepard's 
regt. ; residence, Harwich ; mustered April 3, 1777 ; enlistment, during war ; also, 
Private, Capt. George Webb's (Light Infantry) co.. Col. William Shepard's (4th) 
regt. ; muster rolls for Feb.-Nov., 1781, dated Hutts, 1st Brigade ; also, same co.

1784, signed by Azariah Egleston, stating that said Cowell served in the 1st Mass. 
regt. from Jan 1, 1777, to Nov. 13, 1783, and was honorably discharged.

Cowing, Prince. Private, Capt. Benjamin Bonney's co.. Col. John Dickerson's regt. ; 
enlisted Aug. 17, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 22, 1777 ; service, 8 days, travel included ; 
company marched to Bennington to reinforce army near that place on an alarm. 
Roll dated Chesterfield.

Cowing, Turner, Bridgewater. Private, Capt. Calvin Partridge's co., Lieut. Col.

Crafts, Thomas (also given Jr.) . Official letter from said Crafts to Col. Baldwin, dated 
Chelsea, March 21, 1776, requesting that William Gordon be furnished with a pass

sentatives dated May 8, 1776 ; said Crafts chosen Lieutenant Colonel of an Artil- 
lery regt. to be raised for defence of Boston ; appointment concurred in by Council

regt.; engaged May 8, 1776; service to Nov. 1, 1776, 5 mos. 21 days; roll dated 
Boston ; also, official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives dated

curred in by Council Nov. 28, 1776; reported commissioned Nov. 27, 1776; also. 
Colonel; pay roll for service from Nov. 1, 1776, to Feb. 1, 1777, 3 mos.; reported 
as serving 1 mo. in Colony service, 2 mos. in Continental service ; also, Colonel 
of the State train of artillery ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
Jan. 1, 1777, to Feb. 26, 1779; also, list of officers returned by said Crafts for 
approval, dated Boston, April IS, 1777; also, petition signed by said Crafts, ask- 
ing for clothing; ordered in Council Sept. 26, 1777, that the Board of War deliver 
the clothing; also. Colonel; pay roll for service from Sept. 30, 1777, to Nov. 1, 
1777, 1 mo., on expedition to Rhode Island; also, paj' roll for service between 
Oct. 1, 1777, and Jan. 1, 1778, 2 mos., probably at Rhode Island; also, pay rolls 
for service from Jan. 1, 1778, to Dec. 31, 1778, dated Boston; also, petition dated 
Boston, Feb. 26, 1779, signed by said Crafts, Colonel of an Artillery regt., and 
officers of his regiment, asking that their resignations be accepted as the Legis- 
lature had failed to redress their grievances ; resignations accepted in Council 
Feb. 26, 1779; also, order of Council dated Aug. 26, 1779, stating that said Col. 
Crafts had accepted command of Castle Island during the absence of Lieut. Col. 
Paul Revere, and as he had returned, directing that said Revere resume command 
of the Island, and thanking Col. Crafts for his readiness in accepting such tem- 
porary command.

to expire May -, 1780 ; also, list of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster

Ceane, Ebenezee. Order dated Dorchester, May 30, 1778, signed by Stephen Badlam, 
Superintendent for SuflTolk Co., for the apprehension of said Crane and others, at 
Milton, they having lieen reported to him as Continental soldiers at home without 
leave; the men in question, if supplied with proper furloughs or producing phy- 
sician's certificates of their inability to march, to be permitted to remain at home ; 
also, certificate dated May 30, 1778, signed by John Sprague, Physician, stating 
that said Crane being under inoculation for small-pox was unfit to be moved.

to Rhode Island on an alarm.

command; also, muster roll for Jan., 1782, sworn to at West Point.

served at Ticonderoga for 3 mos. from Sept. 1, 1776; also. Captain, 3d (Shutes- 
bury) CO., 6th Hampshire Co. regt. ; list of officers of Mass. militia returned by 
Phineas Wright and others. Field Officers of said regt., dated Northfield, April 
23, 1776 ; ordered in Council May 7, 1776, that commissions be issued ; reported 
commissioned May 7, 1776; also, Captain, Col. Wright's (Hampshire Co.) regt.; 
engaged July 12, 1777 ; discharged July 29, 1777 ; service, 24 days, travel included ; 
company marched to reinforce Northern army.

Crowel, James, Yarmouth. Private, Capt. Joseph Franklin's co., Col. Nathan 
Tyler's regt. ; enlisted Oct. 18, 1779; discharged Dec. 31, 1779; service, 2 mos. 
13 days, at Rhode Island. 

Ckowel, Jedediah. Private, Capt. George Webb's co.. Col. William Shepard's (3d) 
regt.; muster roll for Oct., 1778, dated Camp at Providence; service, 25 days; 
reported died Oct. 25, 1778 ; enlistment, 8 months. 

Crowel, John (also given Jr.), Danvers. Private, Capt. Enoch Putnam's co., Col. 
John Mansfield's (19th) regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. Israel Hutchinson; 
company return dated Oct. 6, 1775; also, Capt. Samuel Flint's co.. Col. Samuel 
Johnson's regt. ; enlisted Aug. 25, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 30, 1777 ; service, 3 
mos. 19 days, travel included, at the Northward ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay 
roll for mileage from Scarsdale, N. Y., home; warrant allowed in Council July 
27, 1778; also, return dated Boxford, Dec. 8, 1779, of men mustered by John 
Cushing, Muster Master for Essex Co., to join Continental Army for the term of 
9 months. 

Crowel, John, Yarmouth. Private, Capt. Jonathan Crowell's co., which marched on 
the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 3 days; also, Capt. Micah Chapman's co.. 
Col. Freeman's regt. ; service, 3 days, on an alarm at Dartmouth and Falmouth 
Sept. 6, 1778; also, Capt. Simeon Fish's co. ; service, 8 days, on an alarm at 
Dartmouth and Falmouth in Sept., 1778. 

Crowel, John. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Seth Baker's 11th (4th Yarmouth) co., Col. 
Nathaniel Freeman's (1st Barnstable Co.) regt.; list of officers of Mass. militia 
dated Sandwich, March 6, 1777; ordered in Council March 19, 1777, that com- 
missions be issued. 

Crowel, Jonah. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Nathan Basset, Jr.'s 9th (2d Chatham) co., 2d 
Barnstable Co. regt. ; list of officers of Mass. militia returned by Joseph Doane ; 
ordered in Council April 20, 1776, that commissions be issued ; also, 2d Lieuten- 
ant, Capt. Nathan Basset's co., Maj. Zenath Winslow's regt.; service, 6 days, on 
an alarm at Bedford and Falmouth in Sept., 1778. 

Crowel, Jonathan. Private, Capt. John Grannis's (Seacoast) co. ; service from 
March 1, 1776, to June 1, 1776. Roll dated "Tarpaulin Cove. 

Crowel, Jonathan. Capt. John Nickerson's co.. Col. Nathaniel Freeman's regt. ; ser- 
vice, 9 days, on an alarm at Dartmouth and Falmouth in Sept., 1778 ; also. Pri- 
vate, Capt. Joseph Palmer's co. ; enlisted May 3, 1779; discharged Oct. 21, 1779; 
service, 5 mos. 19 days, at Falmouth ; also, Capt. Matthias Tobey's co., Lieut. 
Col. Hallet's regt.; enlisted July 30, 1780; discharged Nov. 2, 1780; service, 3 
mos. 7 days, travel included, at Rhode Island ; company detached to reinforce 
Continental Army for 3 months. 

Crowel, Jonathan, Jr., Yarmouth, Barnstable Co. Private, Capt. Jonathan Crowell's 
CO., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 3 days. 

Crowel, Jos., Falmouth, Barnstable Co. Private, Capt. Joseph Palmer's co., which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 3 days. 

Crowel, Joshua, New Jersey. List of prisoners landed at Falmouth Sept. 2, 1777, re- 
turned as received of Capt. Josiah Godfry by Nathaniel Shiverick, Chairman of 
the Committee of Falmouth. 

Ckowel, Josiah, Philadelphia. Mate ; list of prisoners returned from New York in 
the schooner " Speedwell " Aug. 3, 1777. 

Crowel, Josiah. Private, Capt. Micah Chapman's co., Col. Freeman's regt.; service, 
5 days, on an alarm at Dartmouth and Falmouth Sept. 6, 1778; also, same co. 
and regt. ; service, 2 days, guarding prisoners belonging to the British ship 
" Somerset " cast ashore on the Cape ; roll sworn to Jan. 12, 1779.

pay abstract for travel allowance from home and return (150 miles), dated Rox- 
bury Camp, Jan. -, 1776; company raised in Hardwick, New Braintree and 
Oakham. 

Crowel, Samuel, Haverhill. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Timothy Eaton's co.. Col. Jedediah 
Huntington's regt. ; return of officers dated Roxbury Camp, Dec. 22, 1775 ; or- 
dered in Council Feb. 3, 1776, that commissions be issued; also, 2d Lieutenant, 
Capt. Samuel Merrill's 7th (Haverhill) co.. Col. Samuel Johnson's (4th Essex Co.) 
regt.; list of officers of Mass. militia dated Andover, March 26, 1776; ordered in

3,1776; aZso, Lieutenant, Capt. Samuel Johnson's co.. Col. Titcomb's regt.; ar- 
rived at Providence, R. I., April 27, 1777; discharged June 27, 1777; service, 

2 mos. 10 days, travel included; engagement, 2 months from time of arrival at 
Providence ; roll dated Bristol. 

Crowel, Samvel, Marblehead (also given Salem.) Private; list of men returned as 
serving on main guard at Prospect Hill under Lieut. Col. Loammi Baldwin dated 
July 16, 1775; also, Capt. Micajah Gleason's co., Col. John Nixon's (5th) regt.; 
musterroU dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 23, 1775; service, 3 mos. 16 days; 
also, receipt for wages for Sept., 1775, dated Camp Winter Hill; also, company 
return dated Sept. 30, 1775; also, Capt. Gleason's (3d) co., Lieut. Col. Thomas 
Nixon's (4th) regt.; return dated North Castle, Nov. 9, 1776; also, receipts for 
wages for Sept., Oct. and Dec, 1776; also, same regt.; return of men who en- 
listed for the month of Jan., 1777, dated Springfield, Jan. 25, 1777. 

Crowel, Samuel, Plympton (also given Martin's Vineyard). Private, (late) Capt. 
Thomas Turner's (3d) co.. Col. Gamaliel Bradford's regt. ; Continental Armj'pay 
accounts for service from April 10, 1777, to March 10, 1779; reported enlisted 
March 2, 1777; joined April 4, 1777; also reported deserted; also, Capt. Turner's 
CO., Col. Bradford's regt. ; muster return [year not given] ; residence, Martin's 
(Martha's) Vineyard; enlisted for town of Martin's (Martha's) Vineyard; re- 
ported sick at " Crook Billett; " also, muster roll dated Jan. 15, 1778 ; enlistment, 

3 years; reported sick and absent; also, Corporal, Col. Bradford's regt.; depre- 
ciation roll to make good the depreciation of wages for the first 3 j'ears service in 
the Continental Army from 1777 to 1780.

Chowel, Seth, Harwich. Capt. Samuel King's co. ; order for wages dated Hull, 
June 20, 1776; also, Private, Capt. Samuel King's co., Col. Josiah Whitney's 
regt. ; service from Aug. 1, 1776, 1 mo. 4 days; reported died Sept. 4, 1776; roll 
dated Camp at Hull. 

Crowel, Shiveeick, Hardwick. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce Continen- 
tal Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned 
as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Spring- 
field, July 7, 1780; age, 18 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 10 in.; complexion, light; resi- 
dence, Hardwick; arrived at Springfield July 6, 1780; marched to camp July 7, 
1780, under command of Capt. Dix ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months ser- 
vice and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return 
dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by 
the town of Hardwick for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched 
July 1, 1780; discharged Dec. 1, 1780; service, 5 mos. 16 days, in the state of 
New York ; also, receipt for bounty paid said Crowel by the town of Hardwick for 
6 months service in the Continental Army in 1780.

1782; discharged June 17, 1782; service, 6 days; company inarched to quell the

West Parish in Pembroke to Bristol, R. I., on the alarm of Dec. 8, 1776; also, 
Captain, 2d co. ; returir dated Scituate, March 7, 1778, signed by John Cushing, 
Jr., Colonel of 2d Plymouth Co. regt., stating that agreeable to resolve of Feb. 
24, 1778, he had detached men sufficient to form two companies of 50 men each, 
exclusive of commissioned officers, from said regiment, and that said companies 
marched into camp at Hull March 5, 1778.

CusHMAN, David, Dartmouth. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as 
received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, 
July 13, 1780; age, 17 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 6 in.; complexion, dark; engaged for 
town of Dartmouth; marched to camp July 13, 1780, under command of Capt. 
Thomas Pritchard ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months service and returned 
by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Toto- 
way, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Dart- 
mouth for service in the Continental Army during 1780; marched July 1, 1780; 
discharged Jan. 12, 1781; service, 6 mos. 22 days; also, descriptive list of men 
raised agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, returned as received by Deliverance 
Bennet, at Taunton, May 24, 1781, to be conducted to Springfield and delivered to 
Col.Shepard; age, 17 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; complexion, dark; occupation,

town of Grafton; engaged June 18, 1781; term, 3 years; also, receipt dated 
Grafton, June 18, 1781, for bounty paid said Cutler by the committee of the town 
of Grafton to serve in the Continental Armv for the term of 3 years.

Cutter, Nathaniel, Sr. Private, Capt. Abel Holden's (3d) co., Col. Thomas Nixon's

3, 1777. 

Cutter, Nehemiah. Private, Capt. John Minott's co.. Col. Dike's regt. ; service from 
Jan. 5, 1777, to March 1, 1777; credited to town of Cambridge. 

Cutter, Oliver. Private, Capt. Ralph Thompson's co. ; enlisted Sept. 25, 1779; dis- 
charged Nov. 10, 1779; service, 1 mo. 18 days, under Maj. Gen. Hancock at 
Castle Island; company raised in Suffolk Co. 

Cutter, Oliver. Private, Capt. Nathan Thayer's co., Col. Ebenezer Thayer's (Suffolk 
Co.) regt. ; enlisted July 14, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 9, 1780 ; service, 3 mos. 6 days, 
travel included, at West Point; company raised to reinforce Continental Army 
for 3 months ; also, Capt. Samuel Fisher's co. ; marched to Rhode Island March 

4, 1781 ; discharged March 17, 1781 ; service, 14 days ; company detached from 
4th Suffolk Co. regt. by order of His Excellency John Hancock to serve on a 40 
days campaign under Maj. Gen. Lincoln. [See Oliver Cutler.] 

Cutter, Richard. Private, Capt. John Walton's co., Col. Samuel Thatcher's regt.; 
joined Sept. 2, 1778; discharged Sept. 2, 1778; service, 1 day, with guards at 
Fort No. 2, Cambridge ; also, order dated Cambridge, Sept. 23, 1778, signed by 
Capt. John Walton, directing Sergt. Samuel Butterfield to detach said Cutter and 
others from said Walton's co. to join Capt. Frost the following day at Cambridge, 
and to march from thence to Boston to serve there or elsewhere, as directed by the 
Council, until Jan. 1, 1779, unless sooner discharged. 

Cutter, Richard. List of men [date and particulars not given] ; credited to town of 
Conway. 

Cutter, Samuel, Charlestown. Ensign, Capt. Isaac Hall's co.. Col. Thomas Gard- 
ner's regt. ; list of officers recommended for commissions by Committee of Safety ; 
ordered in Provincial Congress June 2, 1775, that commissions be delivered ; also, 
Ensign, Capt. Isaac Hall's co., Lieut. Col. William Bond's (late Gardner's) 37th 
regt. ; company return dated Prospect Hill, Oct. 6, 1775.

Cutter, Samuel. Lieutenant, Capt. George Rogers's co. ; service, 6 days, iu Nov., 
1775; company detached from 2d Cumberland Co. regt. by order of Col. Jonathan

Russell's 3d (North Yarmouth) co., 2d Cumberland Co. regt.; list of officers of 
Mass. militia as returned by Jonathan Mitchell and others, dated North Yar- 
mouth, April 4, 1776 ; ordered in Council June 5, 1776, that commissions be issued ; 
reported commissioned June 5, 1776. 

Cutter, Samuel. Private, Capt. John Walton's co. ; enlisted Dec. 9, 1776 ; discharged 
Dec. 21, 1776 ; company detached for service at Noddle's Island. 

Cutter, Samuel. Private, Capt. Nathan Sergeant's co.. Col. Jacob Gerrish's regt. of 
guards; detached July 3, 1778; service to July 17, 1778, 14 days, at Winter Hill. 

Cutter, Seth, Cambridge. Sergeant, Capt. Stephen Dana's co., Col. Josiah Whitney's 
regt. ; arrived at destination Maj' 9, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 7 days, at Rhode Island. 
Roll dated South Kingston. 

Cutter, Seth. Private, Capt. Jesse AVyman's co., Col. Jacob Gerrish's regt. of guards ; 
enlisted Feb. 18, 1778; service to May 18, 1778, 3 mos., at Bunker Hill; company 
detached to guard Gen. Burgoyne's army. 

Cutter, Silas. Lieutenant, Capt. John Boynton's co.. Col. Nathan Sparhawk's regt. ; 
engaged July 27, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 25, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 6 days, travel in- 
cluded, under Col. Job Cushing on expedition to Bennington. [See Silas Cutler.] 

Cutter, Solomon. Corporal, Capt. Ezekiel Knowlton's co.. Col. Dike's regt. ; service 
from Dec. 1, 1776, to March 1, 1777 ; credited to town of Brookfield; also, same 
CO. and regt. ; paj^ abstract for gun and blanket money dated Dorchester Heights, 
March 31, 1777. 

Cutter, Solomon. Private, Capt. Thomas Whipple's co.. Col. Abijah Stearns's regt.; 
enlisted March 30, 1778; service to July 2, 1778, 3 mos. 3 days, guarding troops 
of convention ; enlistment, 3 months. 

Cutter, Stephen. Private, Capt. William Adams's co.. Col. Thatcher's regt.; 
marched by request of Gen. Washington at the taking of Dorchester Heights 
March 4, 1776; service, 5 days. 

Cutter, Thomas, Cambridge. Capt. Benjamin Lock's co.. Col. Thomas Gardner's 
regt. ; age, 22 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; enlisted May 2 [year not given, probably

Cutter, Thomas. Sergeant, Capt. William Adams's co.. Col. Thatcher's regt.;

Cutter, William, Medford. List of men engaged to serve in the Continental Army 
as returned by Lieut. Jonathan Porter, dated Medford, June 9, 1777 ; engaged for 
town of Medford; term, 3 years or during war; also, return of men enlisted or 
hired to serve in the Continental Army from 1st Middlesex Co. regt., as returned 
by Lieut. Stephen Hall, dated Medford, Feb. 19, 1778 ; residence, Medford ; engaged 
for town of Medford; joined Capt. Bancroft's co., Col. Jackson's regt.; term, 3 
years; also, list of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for Suffolk 
Co., dated Boston, March 16, 1777 ; also, Private, Capt. James Bancroft's co., Col. 
Michael Jackson's regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from March 
4, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. Wade's co., Col. Michael Jackson's regt.; 
Continental Army.pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to March 10, 1780. 

Cutter, William, Medford. Private, Lieut. Colonel's co.. Col. Greaton's regt. ; Conti- 
nental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; also, 
Lieut. Col. William Hull's co.. Col. Greaton's (3d) regt. ; muster roll for Nov., 
1780; reported on command; also, descriptive list of enlisted men dated West 
Point, Jan. 25, 1781 ; age, 21 (also given 20) yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4 (also given 5 ft. 
3) in.; complexion, light (also given brown); hair, dark; eyes, dark; occupa- 
tion, gentleman soldier; residence, Medford; enlisted March 20, 1780, by Lieut. 
Col. Hull; joined Col. John Greaton's (3d) regt.; enlistment, during war; re- 
ported mustered by Lieut. Meacham, and returned as mustered and paid by 
Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for Suffolk Co. ; also, certificate dated West 
Chester, Sept. 10, 1783, signed by Nathaniel Barber, stating that said Cutter, a 
soldier in 3d Mass. regt., was mustered up to Sept. 1, 1783. 

Cutter, William. Captain, serving as Volunteer, Capt. George Rogers's co. ; service, 
4 days, in Nov., 1775 ; company detached from 2d Cumberland Co. regt. by order 
of Col. Jonathan Mitchel to work on the fort at Falmouth ; also, Captain, 1st 
(North Yarmouth) co., 2d Cumberland Co. regt. ; list of officers of Mass. militia 
as returned by Jonathan Mitchell and others, dated North Yarmouth, April 4, 
1776 ; ordered in Council June 5, 1776, that commissions be issued ; reported com- 
missioned June 5, 1776; also, Captain, 1st (North Yarmouth) co., 2d Cumberland 
Co. regt. ; general return of officers for equipments made by Samuel Thompson, 
dated Brunswick, Aug. 29, 1776 ; 91 men reported as belonging to said Cutter's co. 

Cutter, William. List dated July -, 1776, of men hired to do turns of service on 
Crown Point expedition ; said Cutter sent by Deacon Benjamin Jacquith, prob- 
ably of Wilmington ; credited with 1 turn of service ; also, certificate signed by 
C. Ford, Jr., stating that said Cutter served at Crown Point in Aug. or the 
beginning of Sept., 1776. 

Cutter, William. Sergeant, Capt. William Adams's co.. Col. Thatcher's regt. ; 
marched by request of Gen. Washington at the taking of Dorchester Heights 
March 4, 1776; service, 5 days; also, Sergeant, Capt. Benjamin Blaney's co.. Col. 
Eleazer Brooks's regt. of guards ; joined Jan. 12, 1778 ; service to April 3, 1778, 
83 days, at Cambridge; also. Lieutenant, Capt. John Walton's co. ; joined Sept. 
4, 1778; discharged Sept. 11, 1778. 

Cutter, William. Certificate dated Blandford, May 19, 1790, signed by the Select- 
men, stating that said Cutter served in the war between Great Britain and 
America in the 2d regt. of Mass. Line ; also, order for pay signed by said Cutter, 
dated Halifax, May 18, 1790.

sions be issued to said officers.

[See Richard Caten and Richard Caton.]

Athol; arrived at Springfield July 6, 1780; marched to camp July 7, 1780, under 
command of Capt. Dix.

allowed to Athol.

Cutting, Aaron, Attleborough. Private, Capt. Moses Knap's co.. Col. Joseph Read's 
regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 8, 1775; service, 3 mos. 1

daj', at Rhode Island; enlistment to expire Jan. 1, 1779; also, return of men 
mustered by James Leonard, Muster Master for Bristol Co., to serve in the Conti- 
nental Army for the term of 9 months from the time of their arrival at Springfield, 
dated Oct. 29, 1779; 4th co.. Col. Dean's regt.; age, 27 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; 
complexion, dark; hair, dark; eyes, blue; engaged for town of Attleborough; 
also, Capt. Means's co., r2th regt.; enlisted July 9, 1779; discharged April 9, 
1780 ; also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce Continental Army for the 
term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of 
Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 11, 
1780; age, 22 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 5 in.; complexion, dark; engaged for town of 
Attleborough ; arrived at Springfield July 9, 1780 ; marched to camp July 11, 1780, 
under command of Ensign Bancroft ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months 
service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return 
dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by 
the town of Attleborough for service in the Continental Army during 1780; 
marched July 6, 1780; discharged Jan. 8, 1781 ; service, 6 mos. 2 days.

until Saturday, the 4th day after the fight at Concord.

Cutting, Hezekiah, Brookfield. Return of men enlisted or hired to serve in the Con- 
tinental Army from Capt. John Bannister's (1st Matross) co.. Col. Converse's (4th 
Worcester Co.) regt., Brig. Warner's brigade, dated Brookfield, Feb. 18, 1778; 
residence, Brookfield; engaged for town of Brookfield; joined Capt. Coburn's 
CO., Col. Alden's regt. ; term, 3 years (also given during war) ; reported mustered 
March 5, 1777, by Thomas Newhall, Muster Master for Worcester Co. ; also. Ser- 
geant, Capt. Asa Coburn's co.. Col. John Brooks's regt.; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Feb. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. Coburn's co., 
Col. Ichabod Alden's (6th) regt. ; muster return dated AUmny, Jan. 12, 1778 ; 
reported on furlough; also, Capt. Coburn's co., (late) Col. Alden's regt.; return 
of men in camp before Aug. 15, 1777, certified at Cherry Valley, Fel). 24, 1779; 
also, Lieut. Col. William Stacy's co., Col. Alden's regt.; muster roll for March 
and April, 1779, dated Fort Alden; reported furloughed by Gen. Clinton March 
2, 1779, for 42 days; also, Lieut. Colonel's co., Col. Brooks's regt.; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; also, descrip-

Daggett, Elihu. Adjutant, Col. John Daggett's (4th Bristol Co.) regt.; list of offi- 
cers of Mass. militia dated Mansfield, June 27, 1776; ordered in Council Aug. 
29, 1776, that commissions be issued; said Daggett reported not previously com- 
missioned; rtZw, Adjutant, Col. Daggett's regt. ; engaged Jan. 2, 1778; discharged 
April 1, 1778; service, 3 mos., with Brig. Gen. Ezek Cornell's brigade at Rhode

Daggett, Elijah, Attleborough. Private, Capt. Caleb Richardson's co.. Col. Timothy 
Walker's regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 1, 1775; service, 
3 mos. 8 days; also, company return dated Oct. 6, 1775; also, order for bounty 
coat or its equivalent in money dated Roxbury, Nov. 20, 1775; also. Corporal, 
Capt. Stephen Richardson's (Attleborough) co. ; service from April 21, 1777, to 
May 15, 1777, 25 days ; company marched from Attleborough to Rhode Island 
April 21, 1777, to hold the Lines until men could be raised for 2 months for that 
purpose; also. Sergeant Major, Col. Abiel Mitchel's regt.; appointed April 28, 
1780; discharged Oct. 31, 1780; service, 3 mos. 6 days, at Rhode Island; regi- 
ment detached from Bristol Co. militia to reinforce Continental Army ; reported 
discharged 40 miles from home; roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. 

Daggett, Elijah. Adjutant, Col. Isaac Dean's regt. ; entered service March 5, 1781 ; 
discharged March 16, 1781 ; service, 12 days ; regiment raised in Bristol Co. for 
40 days service at Rhode Island by order of His Excellency John Hancock. Roll 
dated Mansfield.

ton, R. I., on the alarm of July 31, 1780.

July 31, 1780; service, 5 days, at Tiverton, R. I., on an alarm; roll sworn to at 
Rehoboth.

Williams, Superintendent for said county, at Taunton, March 21, 1781, by Joshua 
Wilbore, to be conducted to Springfield and delivered to Col. Shepard; Capt. 
Sim'n Cole's co., 1st regt.; age, 17 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 3 in.; complexion, dark;

Gen. Washington, term of enlistment having expired.

Natick ; arrived at Springfield Aug. 1, 1780 ; marched to camp Aug. 2, 1780, under 
command of Lieut. Benjamin Pike. 

Dagon, Charles. Return of sentences by a court-martial, Maj. Dunlap, President, 
appearing in a general order dated Headquarters Ticonderoga, Nov. 23, 1776, 
taken from Col. Wheelock's Orderly Book ; said Dagon tried on charge of being 
intoxicated while on guard ; pleaded guilty and sentenced to receive 20 lashes, but 
because of favorable cn-cumstances the court recommended a pardon, which was 
granted.

county; age, 19 j'rs.; stature, 5 ft. 7i in.; complexion, dark; hair, dark; eyes, 
gray ; occupation, farmer ; engaged for town of Weston ; engaged March 28, 1781 ; 
term, 3 years.

and others, by a committee in behalf of the town of Natick, for enlisting into the

Dall, John. Captain's Clerk, ship "Protector," commanded by Capt. John Foster

omitted in previous roll through a mistake ; roll dated Boston ; also, certificate 
dated New York, May 13, 1781, signed bj' Capt. John F. Williams, stating that 
said Dall was entitled to rations from Aug. 18, 1780, to Dec. 21, 1780, as Captain's 
Clerk on ship " Protector," having received no rations from the ship during that 
time ; order oh Richard Devens, Esq., Commissary General, for said rations dated 
Aug. 1,1781.

Daniels, Henry, Medway. List of men returned by a committee of the town of 
Medway April 13, 1778, as having rendered service at various times subsequent 
to April 19, 1775. 

Daniels, Henry. List of men drafted to serve in the Continental Army for 8 months, 
dated May 15, 1777. [The sum of £10 appears against name of said Daniels, 
probably paid in lieu of service.] 

Daniels, Henry. Corporal, Capt. John H. Wendell's co.. Col. Goose Van Schaick's 
(1st New York) regt. ; muster rolls for Jan.-April, 1781, dated West Point; en- 
listment, during war. 

Daniels, Henry, Jr. Medway. Private, Capt. Joshua Partridge's (1st Medway) co.. 
Col. John Smith's regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 

7 daj's ; also, list of men returned by a committee of the town of Medway April 
13, 1778, as having rendered service at various times subsequent to April 19, 1775. 

Daniels, Increase, Mendon. Private, Capt. Joseph Daniels's (3d Mendon) co., which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Roxbury ; service, 6 days; reported 
enlisted into the army; also, Capt. David Batchelor's co.. Col. Joseph Read's 
(20th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 1, 1775 ; service, 3 mos. 

8 days ; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, Capt. Peter Penniman's 
CO., in a regiment commanded bj' Lieut. Col. Nathan Tyler; service between Dec. 
8, 1776, and Jan. 21, 1777, 9 days, at Providence; company marched to Rhode 
Island on an alarm. 

Daniels, Isaiah, Medway. Private, Capt. Joshua Partridge's (1st Medway) co., Col. 
John Smith's regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 3 
days ; also, list of men returned by a committee of the town of Medway April 
13, 1778, as having rendered service at various times subsequent to April 19, 1775. 

Daniels, James, Lunenburg. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as 
received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, 
July 11, 1780; age, 17 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 10 in.; complexion, light; engaged for 
town of Lunenburg; marched to camp July 11, 1780, under command of Capt. 
George Webb; also, list of men raised for the 6 months service and returned b}" 
Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, 
Oct. 25, 1780; also, Wst of Massachusetts State Pensioners; pensioned June 12, 
1818, for life ; pension to be paid from Oct. 3, 1816. 

Daniels, James. Capt. William Rogers's (8th) co.. Col. Loammi Baldwin's (38th) 
regt. ; list of men absent from muster dated Chelsea, Sept. -, 1775 ; reported died 
Sept. 17, 1775. 

Daniels, Japheth, Holliston. Lieutenant, Capt. Samuel Cobb's co., Col. Joseph Read's 
regt. ; list of officers dated Camp at Roxbury, May 18, 1775; receipt for commis- 
sions for said officers, signed by Col. Read, dated Watertown, May 24, 1775; also, 
1st Lieutenant, Capt. Samuel Cobb's co.. Col. Joseph Read's regt.; muster roll 
dated Aug. 1, 1775; engaged April 27, 1775; service, 3 mos. 12 days; also, com- 
pany return dated Roxbury Camp, Sept. 26, 1775; also. Captain, Col. Thomas 
Nixon's (6th) regt.; list of officers of Mass. Line; commissioned Jan. 1 (also 
given March 27), 1777 ; also, Captain, Col. Nixon's (6th) regt. ; Continental Army 
pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, 4th co., Col. 
Nixon's (4th) regt.; muster roll dated Van Schaick's Island, Sept. 2, 1777, and 
sworn to in Camp near Stillwater ; also, same i"egt. ; returns for rations dated 
Albany, Oct. 26, 1777, and Dec. 3, 1777 ; also, 4th co.. Col. Nixon's regt. ; muster 
roll for Nov. and Dec, 1777, dated Albany ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll 
made up from Jan. 3, 1778, to May 4, 1778; also, same regt. ; returns of officers 
for clothing dated Boston, April 30, 1778, and Nov. 24, 1778; also, same regt.;

Daniels, Joel. Private, Capt. Nathan Thayer's co., Col. Ebenezer Thayer's (Suffolk 
Co.) regt. ; enlisted July 14, 1780; discharged Oct. 9, 1780, 200 miles from home; 
service, 3 mos. 6 days, travel included ; said Daniels's wages to be paid to the 
town of Franklin as per agreement; company raised to reinforce Continental 
Army for 3 months and stationed at West Point. 

Daniels, John, Ipswich. Private, Capt. Abram How's co. of Minute-men, which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, from West Parish in Ipswich ; service, 2 
days; also, Capt. John Dodge's co., Col. Pickering's regt.; marched Dec. 16, 
1776; discharged March 15, 1777; service, 3 mos. 17 days, travel included; also, 
receipt for mileage given to Capt. John Dodg dated Springfield, March 16, 1777. 

Daniels, John, Uxbridge (also given Northbridge and Mendon). Private, Capt. 
Samuel Read's co., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 7 
days; also, Capt. Andrew Peters's co.. Col. Joseph Read's (20th) regt.; muster 
roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 3, 1775 ; service, 3 mos. 6 days ; also, com- 
pany return dated Roxbury, Sept. 25, 1775 ; also, order for bounty coat or its 
equivalent in money dated Roxbury, Oct. 30, 1775. 

Daniels, John. Descriptive list of officers and crew of the ship " Thorn," commanded 
by Capt. Richard Cowell, sworn to at Marblehead, Sept. 14, 1780; stature, 5 ft. 3 
in.; complexion, dark. 

Daniels, John. Private, Capt. Caleb Champney's co.,Maj. Nathaniel Heath's detach- 
ment of guards; enlisted July 6, 1779; discharged Oct. 1, 1779; service, 2 mos. 
26 days, at and about Boston; also, same co. and detachment; enlisted May 30, 
1780; discharged Aug. 1, 1780; service, 2 mos. 2 days; company detached for 
service at and about Boston; also, Capt. Caleb Champne.y's co. of guards; en- 
listed Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Nov. 1, 1780; service, 3 mos. ; company detached 
from militia for service at and about Boston; also, same co. ; enlisted Nov. 1, 
1780; discharged Jan. 31, 1781; service, 3 mos.; company detached from militia 
for service at and about Boston. 

Daniels, John. Receipt dated Hingham, June 28, 1781, for bounty paid said Daniels 
by John Fearing, Chairman of a class of the town of Hingham, to serve in the 
Continental Army for the terra of 3 years ; also, return of men raised agreeable 
to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780; engaged June 28, 1781 ; engaged for town of Hingham; 
term, 3 years. 

Daniels, John. List of men mustered in Middlesex Co. ; mustered April 5, 1781 ; en- 
gaged for Newtown (Newton) ; term, during war; also, certificate dated Boston, 
July 10, 1781, signed by Elisha Parker and Sam Richardson, in behalf of the town 
of Newton, giving up all claim to said Daniels and agreeing that he be transferred 
to the credit of the town of Marblehead ; also. Private, Capt. Abel Holden's (later 
Capt. Wottles's) co., Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith's (6th) regt.; wages allowed from 
April 5, 1781, to Dec. 31, 1781, 8 mos. 26 days; also, Capt. Mason Wottles's co., 
Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith's regt. ; wages allowed for Jan.-Dec, 1782, 12 months ; 
repoi'ted on command in April, 1782. 

Daniels, Jonathan, Franklin. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as 
received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, 
Aug. 12, 1780 ; age, 19 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, dark ; engaged for 
town of Franklin ; arrived at Springfield Aug. 10, 1780; marched to camp Aug. 
12, 1780, under command of Ensign Boardman ; also, list of men raised for the 
6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster 
in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months men 
raised by the town of Franklin for service in the Continental Army during 1780; 
marched Aug. 7, 1780; discharged Feb. 9, 1781 ; service, 6 mos. 14 days. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 411 

Daniels, Jonathan. Private, Capt. John Boyd's co.. Col. John Dagget's regt. ; en- 
listed Aug. 24, 1778; discharged Sept. 3, 1778; service, 11 days, at Rhode Island; 
also, Capt. Samuel Fisher's co. ; discharged Sept. 12, 1779; service, 1 mo. 2 days; 
company detached from Mass. militia to serve at Rhode Island for the term of 4 
weeks in a regiment under Capt. Samuel Fisher ; roll sworn to at Wrentham, Dec. 
18, 1779. 

Daniels, Jonathan. Certificate dated Cantonment, May 12, 1783, signed by Samuel 
Frost, late Paymaster, stating that wages were due said Daniels for service for 12 
days in Dec, 1781, and the year 1782, in 6th Mass. regt. [See Jonathan Dunnell.] 

Daniels, Jos. Private, Lieut. Col. Jabez Hatch's (Boston) regt.; service with detach- 
ment commanded by Maj. Andrew Symmes, drafted to serve for 5 weeks in guard- 
ing stores at and about Boston under Maj. Gen. Heath, by order of Council of 
May 12, 1777. 

Daniels, Joseph, Barrington. Private, Capt. William Hudson Ballard's co.. Col. 
James Frye's regt.; company return dated Cambridge, Oct. 6, 1775; also, order 
for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Camp at Cambridge, Dec. 13, 
1775. 

Daniels, Joseph, Medway. Private, Capt. Joshua Partridge's (1st Medway) co.. Col. 
John Smith's regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 9 
days; also, Capt. Samuel Cowell's co., Col.L. Robinson's regt.; enlisted Jan. 29, 
1776; service, 2 mos. 4 days; regiment raised in York and Suffolk counties; roll 
dated Roxbury. 

Daniels, Joseph, Medway. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Joseph Lovell's (3d) co., Col. 
Ephraim Wheelock's (4th Suffolk Co.) regt. ; list of officers of Mass. militia dated 
Wrentham, April 8, 1776; ordered in Council April 23, 1776, that commissions 
be issued; reported commissioned April 21, 1776; also, Captain, Col. Ephraim 
Wheelock's regt. ; return dated Watertown, Sept. 17, 1776, of men raised in Suffolk 
Co. for service in Northern department, agreeable to resolve of June 25, 1776, as 
returned by Daniel Perry, Comm. ; said Daniels's company raised in AValpole, 
Medway, Medfield, and Bellingham, and marched July 29, 1776 ; also, same regt. ; 
returns of officers between Aug. 24, 1776, and Nov. 17, 1776, dated Ticonderoga; 
also, same regt. ; return of sentences by a general court-martial, Lieut. Col. Craige, 
President, appearing in a general order dated Headquarters, Ticonderoga, Oct. 28, 
1776, taken from Col. Wheelock's Orderly Book; said Daniels tried on charge of 
neglect of duty; found not guilty and acquitted; also, same regt.; pay abstract 
for mileage from Ticonderoga to Albany, via Skeensborough, and thence home, 
dated Boston, Jan. 15, 1777 ; credited with 14 days allowance. 

Daniels, Joseph, Mendon. Captain, 3d Mendon co., which marched on the alarm of 
April 19, 1775, to Roxbury; service, 10 days; also, 1st Major, Col. Ezra Wood's 
(3d Worcester Co.) regt.; list of field officers of Mass. militia; commissioned 
Feb. 15, 1776; also, 1st Major, Col. Ezra Wood's (3d Worcester Co.) regt.; list 
of officers chosen by their respective companies, as returned by said Daniels and 
others, dated July 9, 1776. 

Daniels, Joseph. Private, Capt. John Tyler's co. ; company return endorsed " Dec. 10, 
1775 " ; company raised in Mendon, Uxbridge, and Upton, and joined Col. Joseph 
Read's regt. 

Daniels, Joseph. Private, Capt. Peter Penniman's co.. Col. Job Cushing's regt.; 
marched Aug. 17, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 24 days, travel 
included, at the Northward. 

Daniels, Joseph. Sergeant, Capt. Elias Parkman's detachment drafted to do duty as 
guards; engaged July 2, 1778; discharged July 17, 1778; service, 15 days; also, 
pay roll for same service dated Boston, Oct. 5, 1778.

Island.

1 mo. 5 days; reported returned home. 

Daniels, Nathan, Wrentham. Matross, Capt. Perez Cushing's co. ; return sworn to

(9th) CO., Col. Crafts's regt.; joined Nov. 1, 1776; service to May 8, 1777, 6 mos. 
7 days.

. alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 8 days ; also, Clerk, Capt. John Metcalf's co., 4th 
Suffolk Co. regt. commanded by Maj. Seth Bullard ; marched July 28, 1780; dis- 
charged Aug. 7, 1780; service, 13 days, travel included; company marched to 
Rhode Island on an alarm. 

Daniels, Nathan. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Pond's co., Maj. Metcalf's regt.; service, 
3 days; company marched from Wrentham to Providence and Warwick, R. I., 
on the alarm of Dec. 8, 1776. 

Daniels, Nathan, Jr., Wrentham. Private, Capt. Thomas Bacon's (1st Wrentham) 
CO.; marched April 30, 1775, on an alarm; left place of rendezvous May 1, 1775; 
service, 2| days. 

Daniels, Nathaniel, Milton. Private, Capt. Ezra Badlam's co.. Col. Loammi Bald 
win's (26th) regt.; pay abstracts for Feb.- June, 1776, dated New York; enlisted 
Jan. 15, 1776; also, account of guns returned by persons belonging to 26th regt. 
while at Trenton Dec. 31, 1776, and Jan. 1, 1777; also, return of men enlisted or 
drafted into Continental Army from Capt. Badcock's co., Col. Benjamin Gill's 
regt., dated Stoughton, June 27, 1777; residence, Milton; engaged for town of 
Milton; joined Capt. Bussey's co.. Col. Crane's regt.; terra, 3 years; also, list of 
men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, 
April 13, 1777; Col. Crane's regt.; also, Matross, Capt. Frothingham's co.. Col. 
John Crane's (Artillery) regt.; Continental Army pay accounts for service fi-om 
March 20, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1777; reported died Dec. 31, 1777; also, muster rolls 
for Sept. and Oct., 1777 ; reported sick in flying hospital ; also, muster rolls for 
Nov. and Dec, 1777 ; reported sick at Trenton. 

Daniels, Nathaniel. Private, Capt. Joseph Warner's co.. Col. Ruggles Woodbridge's 
regt.; engaged Aug. 17 (also given Aug. 18), 1777; discharged Nov. 29, 1777; 
service, 3 mos. 21 days, travel included, on expedition to Northern department.

(21st) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 24, 1775; service, 2 
mos. 12 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; reported sick and 
absent. 

Daniels, Peter. List of men who delivered firelocks ; date of delivery Jan. 9, 1776.

regt.; muster roll dated Camp at Ticonderoga, Nov. 27, 1776; enlisted Jan. 1,

Daniels, Samuel. Private, Capt. Moses Adams's co., Col. Eleazer Brooks's regt. of 
guards ; joined Nov. 3, 1777 ; service to April 3, 1778, 5 mos., at Cambridge ; also, 
Capt. Ezekiel Plimpton's co.. Col. Brooks's regt. ; muster roll dated Dec. 3, 1777; 
reported sick in barracks; also, Capt, Adams's co., Col. Brooks's regt.; muster 
roll dated Cambridge, Jan. 24, 1778; reported sick in hospital. 

Daniels, Samuel. Private, Capt. Asa Fairbanks's co.. Col. Benjamin Hawes's regt.; 
service from Sept. 30, 1777, to Oct. 31, 1777, 1 mo. 2 days, at Rhode Island; roll 
dated Wrentham ; also, Capt. John Boyd's co., Col. John Dagget's regt. ; enlisted 
Aug. 24, 1778; discharged Sept. 3, 1778; service, 11 days, at Rhode Island; also, 
Corporal, Capt. Samuel Fisher's co. ; discharged Sept. 12, 1779; service, 1 mo. 12 
days ; company detached from militia to serve at Rhode Island for the term of 4 
weeks in a regiment under Capt. Fisher; roll sworn to at Wrentham, Dec. 18, 
1779. 

Daniels, Samuel. Private, Capt. John King's co., Col. John Ashley's regt.; enlisted 
Oct. 23, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 25, 1780 ; service, 2 days ; company marched from 
Mt. Washington toward Bennington to guard the frontiers on an alarm. 

Daniels, Samuel. Private, Capt. Oliver Shattuck's co., Hampshire Co. regt. com- 
manded by Lieut. Col. Barnabas Sears ; enlisted Aug. 12, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 
8, 1781; service, 3 mos. 2 days, travel included; company raised for 3 months. 
Roll dated Deerfield. 

Daniels, Simeon, Wrentham. Private, Capt. Elijah Pond's co., which marched on 
the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 3 days; also, Capt. Samuel Cowell's co.. Col. 
L. Robinson's regt.; enlisted Jan. 29, 1776; service, 2 mos. 4 days; regiment 
raised in York and Suffolk counties ; roll dated Roxbury ; also, Capt. Ebenezer 
Pond's CO., Maj. Metcalf's regt.; service, 15 days; companj' marched from 
Wrentham to Providence and Warwick, R. I., on the alarm of Dec. 8, 1776 ; also, 
Capt. John Boyd's co., Col. John Dagget's regt.; enlisted Aug. 24, 1778; dis- 
charged Sept. 3, 1778; service, 11 days, at Rhode Island. 

Daniels, Stephen, Jr. Private, Capt. John Sj^monds's co. of matrosses; enlisted 
July 16, 1776; service, 2 mos. 15 days; company raised in Salem. 

Daniels, Sterling (also given Starling), Williamstown. Private, Capt. Samuel 
Sloane's co., Col. John Paterson's (26th) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; 
enlisted May 5, 1775; service, 3 mos. 4 days; also, order for money in lieu of a 
bounty coat endorsed "Dec. 22, 1775;" also, Capt. Samuel Clark's co.. Col. 
Benjamin Simonds's (Berkshire Co.) regt.; enlisted Sept. 7, 1777; discharged 
Sept. 30, 1777; service, 24 daj's; company marched to Pawlet by order of Maj. 
Gen. Lincoln for 20 days service from time of joining at headquarters ; also, list of 
men mustered by Trueman AVheler, Muster Master for Berkshire Co., dated Gi-eat 
Barrington, June 5, 1778; also, descriptive list of men raised in Berkshire Co. for 
the term of 9 months from the time of their arrival at Fishkill ; Capt. Clark's co.,

1778 ; also, Capt. Samuel Clark's co., Col. Powel's (Berkshire Co.) regt. ; enlisted 
July 22, 1779; discharged Aug. 26, 1779; service, 1 mo. 12 days, travel included, 
at New Haven, Conn.; also, Capt. Samuel Clark's co., Col. Benjamin Simons's 
(Berkshire Co.) regt.; enlisted Oct. 26, 1780; discharged Oct. 27, 1780; service, 3

Board of War dated Camp at White Plains, N. Y., Aug. 19, 1778, for State dona-

of officers for clothing dated Dorchester, Sept. 28, 1778, and Oct. 22, 1778 ; also, 
Col. Bailey's regt. ; certificate signed by Lieut. Col. John Brooks, stating that said 
Darby was in service on or before Aug. 15, 1777, endorsed " Feb. 18, 1779," and 
also endorsed "Leornard's brigade;" also, return of officers for clothing dated 
Dorchester, Sept. 24, 1779; said Darby recommended for Major under the new 
establishment; name cancelled on return; also. Major, Lieut. Col. John Brooks's 
(7th) regt. ; list of settlements of rank of Continental officers dated West Point, 
made by a Board held for the purpose, and confirmed by Congress Sept. 6, 1779; 
saidDarby reported commissioned Nov. 1, 1778 ; also. Major, Col. Ichabod Alden's 
(later Col. Brooks's 7th) regt.; return made up to Dec. 31, 1779; commissioned 
Sept. 30, 1778 ; service, 15 mos. ; also. Major, Col. John Brooks's regt. ; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; reported acting 
as Brigade Inspector; also, Major, acting as Captain, Lieut. Col. Brooks's regt. ; 
muster roll for Oct.-Dec, 1780, dated Huts at West Point; appointed Sept. 29, 
1778 ; also, weekly returns of officers dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 16, Oct. 26, Nov. 
2, Nov. 9, Nov. 23, 1780, Camp Hutts, Dec. 4, Dec. 8, Dec. 22, 1780, Camp near 
West Point, Dec. 28, 1780, German Hutts, West Point, Jan. 5, Jan. 12, Jan. 19, 
Jan. 26, 1781 ; reported acting as Brigade Inspector on the staff; also, muster roll 
for Feb. and March, 1781, dated German Hutts, West Point; appointed Sept. 20, 
1779; reported on furlough in Massachusetts by leave of Gen. Heath from Jan. 
28, 1781, to April 15, 1781; also, muster roll for April, 1781, dated West Point; 
reported on furlough, detained by order of Gen. Lincoln; also, muster roll for 
May, 1781, dated West Point; furlough reported expired, detained by order; 
also, muster roll for June, 1781; reported on command by general order; also, 
weekly returns of officers dated Peekskill, June 22, 1781 ; reported at West 
Point with the boats; Peekskill, June 24, 1781; reported on duty at the Lines; 
Peekskill, June 29, 1781 ; reported at West Point with the boats ; Phillipsburgh, 
July 7, July 12, July 20, July 26, Aug. 2, Aug. 10, Aug. 17; Peekskill, Aug. 25, 
Aug. 31, 1781 ; reported on command with the boats ; West Point, Sept. 8, 1781 ; 
Peekskill, Sept. 21, Sept. 28, 1781; reported sick at West Point; also, muster roll 
for Oct. and Nov., 1781, dated York Huts; also, weekly returns of officers from 
Oct. 5, 1781, to Nov. 23, 1781, dated Peekskill ; reported sick at West Point ; also, 
muster roll for Dec, 1781, dated York Huts; reported on furlough in Massachu- 
setts by leave of Gen. McDougall from Dec. 3, 1781, to March 1, 1782 ; also, weekly 
returns of officers dated Hutts, April 5, April 12, 1782, West Point, April 19, 1782, 
Hutts, April 26, 1782 ; reported attending court martial in garrison ; also, weekly 
return of officers dated May 3, 1782 ; reported attending court martial in garrison ; 
also, Maj. Commandant, Lieut. Col. John Brooks's (7th) regt.; weekly return 
of officers dated West Point, June 21, 1782; also, weekly returns of officers dated 
West Point, July 12, July 19, 1782; reported on duty at the Lines; also, weekly 
returns of officers dated West Point, Aug. 9, 1782, Verplanck's Point, Aug. 13, 
Sept. 6, Sept. 20, Sept. 27, 1782; also, weekly return of officers dated West Point, 
Oct. 3, 1782; reported on fatigtie; also, weekly returns of officers dated Ver- 
planck's Point, Oct. 11, 1782, Windsor, Nov. 8, Nov. 15, Nov. 22, 1782.

Darling, John, Boston. Private, Major's co.. Col. Thomas Marshall's regt.; Conti- 
nental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; resi- 
dence, Boston; credited to town of Concord; reported enlisted in Dec, 1776, 
invalided as certified by Dr. Warren, served 3 years and was discharged ; also, Capt. 
Philip Thomas's co., Col. Thomas Marshall's regt.; subsistence allowed from 
date of enlistment, Dec. 19, 1776, to Feb. 6, 1777; credited with 50 days allow- 
ance; subsistence also allowed for 11 days travel on march from Boston to Ben- 
nington ; also, detachment from same co. ; pay abstract for rations due from Feb. 
18, 1777, to June 2, 1777; 105 days rations allowed; also, Lieut. Ephraim Minot's 
CO. of invalids stationed at Boston; joined June 2-1, 1778; service to Oct. 1, 1778,

min Wallcut, stating that said Darling was in camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777,

Continental Army [year not given] . 

Darling, Samuel, Duxbury. Private, Capt. Samuel Bradford's (1st Duxbury) co., 
Col. Warren's regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 3 
days; also, Capt. William Weston's co. ; enlisted July 9, 1776; discharged Nov. 
19, 1776 ; service, 4 mos. 11 days ; company stationed at the Gurnet for defence of 
Plymouth harbor; also, list of men mustered in Plymouth Co. by James Hatch, 
Muster Master, to serve until Jan. 1, 1779, endorsed " mustered for 9 months ; " 
Capt. Arnold's co. ; engaged for town of Duxbury ; also. Private, Capt. Calvin 
Curtiss's CO., Col. John Jacobs's regt.; enlisted July 1, 1778; service to Jan. 1, 
1779, 6 mos. 3 days, at Rhode Island. 

Darling, Samuel, New Marlborough. Return of men raised to serve in the Conti- 
nental Army probably from Capt. Wheeler's co. [year not given] ; residence. New 
Marlborough; engaged for town of New Marlborough ; joined Capt. Stone's co., 
Col. Brewer's regt. ; term, during war. 

Darling, Samuel. Private, Capt. Jesse Holbroolc's co.. Col. Wheelock's regt. ; ser- 
vice, 11 days; company marched from Bellingham to Warwick, R. I., on the 
alarm of Dec. 8, 1776 ; also, Capt. Amos Ellis's co.. Col. Benjamin Haws's regt. ; 
enlisted Sept. 25, 1777; service to Oct. 31, 1777, 1 mo. 7 days, at Little Compton, 
R. I. ; roll dated Bellingham. 

Darling, Samuel. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Washburn's co.. Col. Eleazer Brooks's 
regt. of guards ; enlisted Nov. 8, 1777 ;■ service to April 3, 1778, 4 mos. 25 days, at 
Cambridge. 

Darling, Samuel. Private, Capt. Rufus Lincoln's co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks's 
(7th) regt.; muster roll for Jan., 1781, dated West Point; enlisted July 8, 1780;

Darling, Samuel. Private, Col. Benjamin Tupper's (10th) regt. ; service from July

Darling, Samuel. Capt. Nathan Thayer's co. ; list of men who served 3 months in

Darling, Samuel, Jr., Duxbury. Private, Capt. Samuel Bradford's (1st Duxbury) 
CO., Col. Warren's regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 
1 day ; also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce Continental Army for the 
term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of 
Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 10, 
1780; age, 21 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; complexion, dark; engaged for town of 
Duxbury; arrived at Springfield July 9, 1780; marched to camp July 10, 1780, 
under command of Capt. Daniel Shays ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months 
service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return 
dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by 
the town of Duxbury for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched 
July 3, 1780; discharged Jan. 14, 1781 ; service, 6 mos. 18 days. 

Darling, Seth. Private, Capt. Benjamin Read's co., Col. John Rand's (Worcester 
Co,) regt.; enlisted July 14, 1780; discharged Oct. 10, 1780; service, 3 mos. 7 
days, travel included, at West Point; regiment raised to reinforce Continental 
Army for 3 months.

regt.; service between Dec. 8, 1776, and Jan. 21, 1777, 1 mo. 8 days, at Provi- 
dence, R. I.

Darling, Timothy, Grafton. Official record of a ballot \>y the House of Representa-

curred in by Council Jan. 23, 1776. 

Darling, Timothy, Lunenburg. Capt. Abel Wilder's co.. Col. Ephraim Doolittle's

Darling, Timothy, Marlborough. Private, Capt. Cyprian How's co., which marched 
on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge ; service, 7 days ; company dismissed 
May 4, 1775, by order of Col. Jonathan Ward; also, Capt. Abner Cranson's co., 
Col. Asa Whitcomb's regt. ; receipt for wages for Sept., 1775, dated Prospect Hill ; 
also, company return dated Prospect Hill, Oct. 6» 1775 ; reported deserted in June, 
1775, returned Sept. 18, 1775 ; also, receipt for bounty coat or its equivalent in 
money dated Prospect Hill, Nov. 2, 1775. 

Darling, Timothy, Princeton. Return of men raised for Continental service from 
Capt. Mirick's co., Col. Whitney's regt. [year not given] ; age, 35 yrs. ; stature, 
5 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of Princeton ; term, 9 months.

Joseph Read's regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; engaged April 26, 1775;

Darling, Zelek, Mendon. Private, Capt. Thomas Marshall Baker's co.. Col. Samuel 
Denny's regt.; enlisted Oct. 23, 1779; discharged Nov. 23, 1779; service, 1 mo. 
11 days, at Claverack; company raised for 3 months; roll dated Upton; also, 
descriptive list of men raised to reinforce Continental Army for the term of 6 
months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, 
Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, Julj^ 12, 1780; age, 18 
yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 5 in.; complexion, light; engaged for town of Mendon; 
marched to camp July 12, 1780, under command of Ensign Gilbert; also, Private, 
(late) Capt. John Holden's co.. Col. Thomas Nixon's (6th) regt. ; pay abstract for 
July, 1780; joined July 12, 1780; service, 20 days; also, list of men raised for 
the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed mus- 
ter in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, pay roll for 6 months 
men raised by the town of Mendon for service in the Continental Army during 
1780; marched July 8, 1780; discharged Jan. 2, 1781; service, 6 mos. 13 days;

charge, Dec. 18, 1780, 4 mos. 18 days; enlistment, 6 months; a/so, account dated 
Mendon, Aug. 2, 1781, returned by the Selectmen, of bounties paid said Darling 
and others, in March, 1781, to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 
years; also. Private, Capt. Nathan Goodale's co., Col. Rufus Putnam's (5th) 
regt. ; muster roll for April, 1781, dated Garrison at West Point; enlisted Feb. 8, 
1781 ; enlistment, 3 years ; reported on command at New Windsor.

Dascombe, Jacob. Descriptive list of men raised in Essex Co. in 1779, to serve in the 
Continental Army ; Capt. Lovejoy's co. ; age, 19 yrs. ; stature, 6 ft. 1 in. ; com- 
plexion, light; engaged for town of Andover; delivered to Capt. Christopher 
Marshall ; also, receipt dated Andover, July 3, 1779, for bounties paid said Das- 
combe and others, by Nathaniel Lovejoy, in behalf of the 3d co. in Andover, to 
serve in the Continental Army for the term of 9 months, agreeable to resolve of 
June 9, 1779 ; also, return dated Boxford, Dec. 8, 1779, of men mustered by John 
Cushing, Muster Master for Essex Co. ; also, return of men raised agreeable to re-

15 days.

men, Col. Lemuel Robinson's regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775;
