service, 5 days, in March, 1776, guarding the Lines near Dorchester Heights ; roll 
dated Dorchester; also, same co. and regt.; service, 12 days, at Dorchester, in 
March, 1776, guarding shores at mouth of Milton river; roll dated Dorchester; 
also, Capt. Seth Sumner's co.. Col. Benjamin Gill's regt. ; service, 3 days ; com- 
pany ordered to march to Moon Island June 12, 1776; also, Capt. John Bradley's 
CO., Col. Benjamin Gill's regt. ; enlisted Aug. 14, 1777; service, 3 mos. 16 days; 
reported on furlough ; company marched to Manchester, Vt., to join Northern 
army; roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. and endorsed "raised for 3 months;" also, 
Capt. Lemuel Clap's co., Maj. Nathaniel Heath's detachment of guards; enlisted 
May 17, 1779; discharged Aug. 12, 1779; service, 2 mos. 27 days, at Dorchester.

arm J' under Gen. Stark.

Davenport, William, Milton. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. John Bradley's (Milton) co., Col.

Col. Benjamin Gill's regt.; marched March 4, 1776; service, 5 days; company 
marched to Dorchester Neck when the forts were erected on the Heights ; also, 
petition dated Milton, Oct. 10, 1777, signed by said Davenport, asking that he be 
discharged from custody and relieved from serving in the army on account of 
having provided an able-bodied substitute, he having been drafted to serve with 
reinforcements to the Northern army for 3 months ; ordered in Council Oct. 10, 
1777, that said Davenport be discharged if substitute proved satisfactory. .

Dracut ; also, Private, Capt. Amos Foster's co.. Col. C3'prian How's regt. ; enlisted 
July 8, 1780; discharged Oct. 10,1780; service, 3 mos. 14 days, travel included; 
company detached from 7th Middlesex Co. regt. to reinforce the Continental Army 
for the term of 3 months ; said Davis with 13 others marched to Fishkill instead 
of to Rhode Island where the remainder of the company was sent.

Col. Commandant Calvin Smith to His Excellency Gov. Hancock, dated Hutts, 
New Boston, May 1, 1782, stating that said Davis, Ensign in the 8th regt., had 
been recommended to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of Lieut. Fowler 
of the 6th regt., but as it has since appeared that Ensign Levi Bradley of the 4th 
regt. ought properly to succeed to the above named vacancy, the request for the 
promotion of Ensign Davis is accordinglj' withdrawn and the statement is made 
that he will be provided for in the 3d regt. ; also, letter from Lieut. Col. William 
Hull, of 3d regt., to His Excellency Gov. Hancock, dated Boston, May 23, 1782, 
stating that said Davis, Ensign in 8th regt., was entitled to a Lieutenantcy in the 
3d regt. from March 15, 1782, vice Lieut. Samuel Burnham, deceased ; advised in 
Council June 17, 1782, that a commission be issued.

man's regt. ; marched Sept. 26, 1777 ; service to Oct. 26, 1777, 30 days ; regiment

dressed to the General Court, in behalf of said Davis of Shirley, formerly in Capt. 
Smith's CO., Col. Bigelow's regt., who was wounded Feb. 3, 1780; a resolve on 
the above petition, dated April 20, 1781, allowing said Davis one-third of his pay, 
as a pension, from the date of his discharge, Dec. 22, 1780, was non-concun-ed in 
the Senate and failed to pass.

Maj. Gen. Gates at Boston; also, Mai. Nathaniel Heath's co. ; enlisted May 4,

order of Sir George Collier June 28, 1777, as returned by John Emerson, Com- 
missary ; reported taken in a trading vessel. 

Dean, Joseph. Corporal, Capt. Samuel Johnson's co.. Col. Johnson's regt.; enlisted 
Aug. 14, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 30, 1777 ; service, 4 mos., travel included, with 
Northern army. Roll sworn to at Andover.

enlistment, during war; also. Sergeant, Capt. Samuel Shaw's co., Col. John 
Crane's (3d) regt.; muster roll for Feb. and March, 1781, dated West Point; 
reported serving as Quartermaster Sergeant at the Park ; also, muster roll for 
April, 1781, dated North Redoubt; reported acting as Quartermaster Sergeant at 
the Park.

De Guiscard, Raymond. Letter from T. Crafts, Colonel of the Artillerj% to the 
Council, dated Boston, Jan. 26, 1779, recommending said De Guiscard, a French 
gentleman who had served as an officer on the Continental ship "Boston," for 
commission as 2d Lieutenant in his regiment; ordered in Council, Jan. 28, 1779, 
that a commission be issued; reported commissioned Jan. 28, 1779; also, 1st 
Lieutenant, Capt. Jonathan Warner's co., Lieut. Col. Paul Revere's corps of artil- 
lery; list of officers; commissioned March 23, 1779; also, Lieutenant, Lieut. Col. 
Paul Revere's corps of artillery; return for rations from Jan. 1, 1780, to date of 
dischai'ge. May 8, 1780; credited with 129 days allowance; also, certificate dated 
Boston, May 9, 1780, signed by Lieut. Col. Paul Revere, stating that said De Guis- 
card had served with credit 18 months as 1st Lieutenant in the artillery corps 
under his command, and was discharged by reason of the expiration of the terra 
of enlistment of said corps. May 8, 1780 ; also, petition dated Boston, Aug. 2, 1780, 
signed by said De Guiscard, stating that he had engaged to raise a company to 
serve to the credit of Mass. under resolve of June 21, 1780, but had been prevented 
from doing so by the small amount allowed for securing recruits, and requesting 
that he may be granted leave to go to Rhode Island and join the army there under 
Gen. Heath; in Council, Aug. 2, 1780, application complied with; also, Captain, 
Col. Turner's regt. of 5 months levies raised for defence of Rhode Island ; engaged 
July 4, 1781 ; discharged Dec. 4, 1781 ; service, 5 mos. 3 days ; roll dated Boston.

wages for May-Oct. [year not given] as a Private, and for Nov. and Dec. [year 
not given] as a Corporal, appearing in a memorandum of orders accepted on 
account of wages.

Northern department; company marched from Western and Oakham Sept. 24, 
1777, to join army under Gen. Gates.

ough belonging to his regiment, together with the alarm list, to meet and make 
choice of officers.

Dewey, Paul. Letter dated Sheffield, Feb. 1, 1777, from John Fellows, Brigadier, to the 
Council, stating that he had caused a company of matrosses to be raised in Sheffield 
in the 1st regt. in his brigade, and said company had chosen William Fellows, 
Captain, Paul Dewey, 1st Lieutenant, and William Bement, 2d Lieutenant; re- 
ported commissions ordered; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. William Fellows's co. of 
matrosses, 1st Berkshire Co. regt. ; list of officers of Mass. militia [year not given] ; 
also. Lieutenant, commanding a detachment of Capt. William Fellows's co. of 
matrosses, Brig. Gen. John Fellows's (Berkshire Co.) brigade; roll made up for 
service between Sept. 21, 1777, and Oct. 19, 1777 ; detachment ordered out by Brig. 
Fellows to serve under Maj. Gen. Gates in Northern department ; also. Lieutenant, 
Capt. William Fellows's co. of matrosses, Col. John Ashley's (Berkshire Co.) 
regt. ; engaged Oct. 15, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 17, 1780; service, 4 days ; company 
marched on an alarm when Forts Ann and George were taken by the enemy.

DiBBELL, Benjamin, EastHoosuck. Capt. Samuel Sloan's co.. Col. John Paterson's

DiBBELL, Charles, Lenox. Captain of a company of Minute-men, Col. John Pater- 
son's regt., which marched April 22, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 
1775; service, 13 days; also. Captain; general return of Col. Paterson's regt., 
showing field and company officers of said regt. ; ordered in Provincial Congress 
May 27, 1775, that commissions be delivered the officers mentioned ; also, Captain, 
Col. Patterson's regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; engaged May 5, 1775 ; ser- 
vice, 3 mos. 4 days; also, petition to the Council dated Watertown, Sept. 8, 1776, 
signed by said Dibbell, stating that he raised a company of Minute-men in the 
winter and spring of 1775, and furnished them with arms at his own expense, and 
marched with said company on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge and 
there joined the army ; that soon after his arrival at Cambridge he returned to 
Berkshire Co. to enlist men to complete the army and to procure firearms, etc. ; 
that he enlisted five full companies, three of which joined army at Cambridge, and 
two the army that went to the Northward ; that he went to Albany where he pur- 
chased firearms and blankets for army at Cambridge; and asking to be recom- 
pensed for expenses incurred in the performance of his duties ; resolved by General 
Court Sept. 10, 1776, that £10 be paid said Dibbell.

town of Dartmouth ; marched to camp July 13, 1780, under command of Capt. 
Thomas Pritchard ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months service and returned 
by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Toto- 
way, Oct. 25, 1780.

of said class. 

Dick, Warwick, Sturbridge. Private, Capt. Benjamin Allton's co.. Col. John Rand's 
regt.; enlisted July 9, 1780; discharged Oct. 10, 1780; service, 3 mos. 11 days, 
travel included; company raised for 3 months service at West Point; roll sworn 
to at Charlton; also, receipt dated Boston, April 6, 1782, for bounty paid said 
Dick by Josiah Waterman, Chairman of Class No. 1 of the town of AVeymouth, 
to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years ; also, certificate dated 
Dorchester, Aug. 22, 1782, signed by Ezra Badlam, certifying that Ebenezer 
Crafts, Esq., of Sturbridge, claimed said Dick, who acknowledged that he had 
run away from his master March 28 "last," and enlisted himself to serve 
3 years in the Continental Army to the credit of the 1st Class in the town of 
Weymouth, and stating that Gardner Goolds had signed a certificate in his pres- 
ence relinquishing all claim to said Dick on behalf of the town of Weymouth ; 

also, certificate dated AVeymouth, 22, 1782, signed by Gardner Goold, stating 

that Ebenezer Crafts, Esq., having produced a certificate from Selectmen of Stur- 
bridge, Worcester Co., that Warwick Dick, a negro, who had engaged to serve in 
the Continental Armj' for 3 years for the 1st Class in Weymouth, was the property 
of said Ci'afts, and an inhabitant of Sturljridge, all claim to the service of said

wick Dick, an iiiliabitant of Sturbridge, had been examined and passed muster to

Dickinson, Thomas, Deerfield. Captain, 1st co.. Col. David Field's (5tli Hampshire 
Co.) regt. ; list of officers of Mass. militia dated Deerfield, April 22, 1776 ; ordered 
in Council May 3, 1776, that commissions be issued; reported commissioned May 
3, 1776 ; also, return of men enlisted into Continental Army from said Capt. 
Dickinson's co., 5th Hampshire Co. regt., dated Deerfield, Sept. 4, 1777 ; also, 
resignation dated Deerfield, April 13, 1780, addressed to the Council, signed by 
said Dickinson, stating that he had received a commission as Captain of 1st co., 
5th regt., dated May 3, 1776, but through infirmity and old age was no longer able 
to fulfil the duties of the office, and asking that his resignation be accepted ; state- 
ment certified by Lieut. Col. David Wells ; ordered in Council April 25, 1780, that 
resignation be accepted.

of a ballot by the House of Representatives dated March 28, 1776 ; said Dillingham

commissioned; reported commissioned Dec. 11, 1776.

his room ; reported petition granted.

Dissmore, Thomas. Petition to the Council dated Boston, Aug. 16, 1777, signed by said 
Dissmore, stating that he had been put on board the prize ship " Mercury," taken 
by Capt. Abijah Boden Dec. 27, 1776, and on Feb. 2, 1777, was retaken by the 
frigate " Richmond," and carried to New York, where he had been held a prisoner 
for almost 4 months, and having been permitted to come to Boston on parole, 
asks that he maj' make necessary arrangements for his exchange; ordered in 
Council Aug. 16, 1777, that the prayer of the petitioner be granted, and that he 
be permitted to send a man of equal rank to New York, and the Commissary is 
directed to effect such exchange.

himself and others, of Salem, asking that Joseph Leech be commissioned as com-

commission be issued; also, petition dated Boston, Feb. 1, 1781, signed by 
William Shattuck, in behalf of Thomas Lee and others, of Salem, asking that 
said Divers be commissioned as commander of the brigantine "Flying Fish" 
(privateer) ; advised in Council Feb. 1, 1781, that a commission be issued.

in the room of said Doane and 6 others from the town of Eastham, who had been 
sent forward as recruits, but who were rejected by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at 
Springfield, on account of their youth and being undersized.

mon's regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 4, 1775; service, 3 
mos. 5 da}'s ; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Cam- 
bridge, Oct, 28, 1775. 

DoNELLT, John. Private, Capt. Jeremiah Hickok's co., Berkshire Co. regt. com- 
manded by Lieut. Col. Sears ; enlisted Aug. 6, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 8, 1781 ; 
service, 3 mos. 7 days, travel included ; company raised for 3 months. Roll en- 
dorsed " Col. Elisha Porter's regt." 

DoNELLT, Terence. Private, Capt. Erastus Sargent's co., Col. Benjamin Simonds's 
detachment of Berkshire Co. militia; enlisted Dec. 16, 1776; discharged March 
22, 1777 ; service, 97 days, travel included, at Ticonderoga. 

DoNELS, Daniel. Private, Colonel's co.. Col. Gamaliel Bradford's (14th) regt.; mus- 
ter roll for Oct.-Dec, 1780, dated Huts near West Point; enlisted July 9, 1780; 
discharged Dec. 19, 1780; term, 6 months. 

DoNELSON, Daniel, Colrain. Private, Capt. Robert Oliver's co., Col. Ephraim Doo- 
little's regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted July 29, 1775; service, 
2 days ; also, company return dated Winter Hill, Oct. 6, 1775 ; also, Capt. Samuel 
Taylor's co., Col. Nicholas Dike's regt. ; pay abstract for mileage, etc., home, 
dated Dorchester Heights, Nov. 28, 1776. 

DoNELSON, Matthew. Private, Capt. Hugh McClallen's co., Col. David Wells's regt. ; 
enlisted Sept. 22, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 18, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 2 days, travel 
included, with Northern army. Roll sworn to in Hampshire Co. 

DoNELT, Henry. Private, Capt. Ezra Whittelsey's co., 3d Berkshire Co. regt. ; en- 
listed Oct. 20, 1780; discharged Oct. 22, 1780; service, 2 days, on an alarm at the 
Westward; also, Capt. Isaac Marsh's co.. Col. Sears's (Berkshire Co.) regt.; 
mustered July 21, 1781; discharged Nov. 2, 1781; service, 3 mos. 12 days; 
regiment stationed at Fort Plain, Tryon Co., under Brig. Gen. Stark. 

DoNELY, Terence. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Cook's co.. Col. John Brown's (Berk- 
shire Co.) regt. ; enlisted Sept. 20, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 14, 1777 ; service, 24 days, 
at the Northward. 

Doner, Benjamin. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Everet's co.. Col. Mcintosh's regt., Gen. 
Lovell's brigade; enlisted Aug. 6, 1778; discharged Sept. 14, 1778; service, 1 mo. 
9 days, at Rhode Island. 

Donevan, Mark. Seaman, frigate " Deane," commanded by Capt. Samuel Nicholson ; 
engaged Dec. 7, 1781; service to May 31, 1782, 5 mos. 24 days; engagement, 
12 months. 

DoNEY, John. Private, Capt. Solomon Brown's co.. Col. Elisha Porter's (Hampshire

DoTEX, Stephen. Corporal, Capt. Robert Finney's co., Col. Lothrop's regt. ; service,

DoTEx, Thomas, Plympton. Private, Capt. John Bridgham's co.. Col. Theophilus 
Cotton's regt. ; company return dated Oct. 7, 1775 ; also, return of men raised to 
serve in the Continental Army from Capt. Nathaniel Shaw's (2d Plympton) co., 
1st Plymouth Co. regt., dated Plympton, Feb. 23, 1778; residence, Plympton; 
engaged for town of Plympton ; joined Capt. Seth Drew's co., Col. Baley's regt. ; 
term, 3 years; reported received bounty March 15, 1777. 

DoTEN, Thomas. 2d Lieutenant, brig " Freedom," commanded by Capt. John Clouston ; 
engaged July 23, 1777; discharged April 21, 1778; service, 8 mos. 29 days; re- 
ported commissioned Sept. 4, 1777 ; also, petition to the Governor and Council 
signed by said Doten, stating that he commanded the ship " Russel," bound from 
Salem to Hispaniola, which on her outward passage was captured by the Halifax 
Packet and carried to New York, that he was then paroled to Flatt Lands, 
Long Island, until some time in Nov., 1782, when he was permitted to go on 
parole to Boston in the cartel sloop " Betsey " in order to effect his exchange for 
a prisoner of equal rank, failing which he was to return to New York on or before 
the middle of Feb., 1783, and requesting that measures be taken to effect his 
exchange ; advised in Council Jan. 30, 1783, that the Commissary of Prisoners be 
directed to exchange a British prisoner of equal rank for said Doten.

missary ; reported taken in the privateer " Hope."

age, 24 yrs. ; cause of disability, wound received during an engagement with a

out at his right side ; pensioned April 1, 1783.

DoAV, Samuel. Private; list of men returned as serving on main guard at Cambridge 
under Maj. Loammi Baldwin dated May 15, 1775. 

Dow, Samuel. Letter dated Boston, Jan. 15, 1786, from said Dow to James Perkins, 
stating that he and others had been employed as blacksmiths in Quartermaster's 
department at Boston from early in 1776, to Jan. 1, 1778, when owing to depre- 
ciation of money their wages were insufficient, whereupon they applied to Col. 
Chase for £9 specie per month or its equivalent, as wages, but as they failed to 
receive any increased allowance they applied to Gen. Heath, who promised to 
write to Gen. Pickering and secure the advance requested; they remained con- 
tinuously in service until Sept., 1780, their pay remaining unchanged until March 
1, 1780, when they were allowed £9 per month in specie notes ; the claim for the 
extra allowance asked for was apparently not granted as the foregoing letter was 
read in Continental Congress and returned to said Dow without action, and two 
endorsements bearing dates Boston, Oct. 15, 1788, and Sept. 27, 1790, show that 
the grievance of the claimants was not redressed at the respective dates ; also, list 
of blacksmiths stationed at Boston as returned by Thomas Chase, Deputy Quarter- 
master General [year not given] . 

Dow, Samuel, Jr., Salisbury. Private, Capt. Stephen Merrill's co., Col. Caleb Cush- 
ing's regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 
1775; service, 3^ days.

Providence; afco, petition dated Boston, Jan. 25, 1780, signed by said Downes, 
stating that he had held a commission in Col. Crane's (Artillery) regt., from which 
he had secured a dismissal and then entered the state service as Lieutenant of 
Marines, on board the brigantine " Tyrannicide," serving until the vessel was 
destroyed ; he then had been commissioned as Captain of Marines, on board the 
ship "Protector," in which capacity he had served from Oct. 14, 1779, but as in 
consequence of a new establishment for the " Protector," no Captain of Marines 
is provided for, and he is in consequence reduced in rank and rating to a Lieuteu- 



IX THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 925 



DoAVNUs, William, continued. 

ant, he respectfully protests against being compelled to accept a rating for prize 
shares in a lower class than the one for which he was originally commissioned ; 
petition also states that he had spent 5 years in service, had been held prisoner by 
the enemy for 18 months, and had three times lost all his clothing, twice with the 
army, and once on Penobscot expedition.

having been a prisoner of war from Dec. 27, 1777, and as entitled to rank of 
Captain from April 14, 1780, in case of his exchange; «Z«o, recommendation dated 
Springfield, June 23, 1781, signed by Col. William Shepard of 4th Mass. regt., 
asking for a commission as Captain for said Drew, Lieutenant, in room of Capt. 
Cooper, retired, to date from April 14, 1780, said Drew having been in captivity 
at New York for almost 3 years and not exchanged until " some time last winter " 
and therefore failed to fill his proper vacancy at the time ; advised in Council 
June 26, 1781, that said Drew be commissioned; also, Captain, 6th co.. Col. Wil- 
liam Shepard's (4th) regt.; muster rolls for June-Sept., 1781, dated Phillipsburg

pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780 to Aug. 27, 1780. 

Dryer, Samuel. Private, Capt. Joseph Willmarth's co.. Col. Thomas Carpenter's 
regt.; marched July 28, 1780; discharged July 31, 1780; service, 5 days, under 
Gen. Heath at Tiverton, R. I., on an alarm ; company detached for 6 days service. 

Dryer, William (also given 3d), Rehoboth. Corporal, Lieut. John Dryer's co.. Col. 
Thomas Carpenter's regt. ; service, 16 days ; company marched from Rehoboth 
to Bristol, R. I., on the alarm of Dec. 8, 1776; also, Capt. Stephen Bullock's co., 
Col. Thomas Carpenter's (Bristol Co.) regt.; entered service July 27, 1778; dis- 
charged Sept. 10, 1778; service, 1 mo. 16 days, at Rhode Island; also. Sergeant, 
Capt. Simeon Cole's co., Col. Thomas Carpenter's regt. ; entered service Aug. 2, 
1780; discharged Aug. 8, 1780; service, 7 days; company marched to Tiverton, 
R. I., on an alarm.
